39501.description:
This is an expansion for Duel in the Dark: Baby Blitz. It adds another asset counter for the Germans, the V1 launch bunker at St. Pol.

From the card:

V1 Bunker
Wasserwerk 1 St. Pol

The Wasserwerk (WW) marker protects a V1 from Mosquito interception. The marker is placed on the map when the other German fighters are placed on the game board - not secret placement. One may be placed on the board in any legal hex. Placement of the WW marker costs the German player 1VP. The effect of the WW marker prevents the Mosquito(s) from intercepting the V1 on the turn/in the hex in which it takes off. The WW protects one V1 in the hex.

Der Wasserwerk Spielstein schützt eine V1 vor dem Abfangen durch die Mosquito in dem Zug in dem sie vom Hex mit dem „Wasserwerk" startet. Der „Wasserwerk" Spielstein wird offen auf dem Spielbrett platziert wenn die deutschen Jäger gesetzt werden. Der Einsatz des Spielsteins kostet den deutschen Spieler 1 SP.

Expands:

Duel in the Dark
Duel in the Dark: Baby Blitz
39501.name: Duel in the Dark: V1-Bunker
boardgameexpansion: Duel in the Dark: Baby Blitz
Duel in the Dark: Second Edition

39503.name: Byggare Bob: Samla verktygen
39503.description:
Use the roundel to randomly identify tools the players may add to their player boards (toolbox) to complete the pattern consisting of tiles of tools.

First one to collect all the tools, and having placed them in the right order, wins. If all tools have been properly placed, the players have also made a picture of Bob and his friends. Turn the toolbox upside down and see if all the tiles were correctly placed.

39504.name: The Raider Attack Banana Village Minigame
39504.description:
The Raiders are attacking Banana village again! This time they are not going to hold back!

This is a game for 2 players where one player control the Raiders while the other controls the villagers. Villagers set traps and save routes, while Raiders maneuver through the map, both players collect points according to their strategy and player with the highest points is the winner.

39505.name: Porto Seguro
39505.description:
Porto Seguro was specifically designed to learn about the Belgian social security system. A system where everybody obligatory contributes taxes to a fund that redistributes that money to those who need it most.

The game mimics this system as players start out at different wealth-levels and have to contribute, by sharing their wealth with other players. Players who do so get rewarded, players who don't get punished.

The game is designed so that when you're wealthy you have more options, but you have to contribute more. When you're poor you have fewer options but get supported by the game's system.

At the start of each turn players receive their income in the form of cards. Some of those go into the social security system to support the less fortunate players.

Players can trade the remaining cards with each other. Those involved in the trade can perform the action on the card. Actions involve moving up or down on the social ladder.

The cards have differently colored background and the final goal is to get seven cards of the same color.

The game is lightened up by using a theme that is not directly related to the matter. Players are boat owners with boats ranging from a luxury yacht to driftwood.

39506.name: What Can You See?
39506.description:
A collection of detective games
Through play, close observation is stimulated and vocabulary broadened.

The twins Tony and Tina have a superb idea; together with their three friends they want to found a secret society. The secret society’s goal will be to resolve exciting cases and become authentic detectives. On tender hooks the five have their first secret meeting in the tree house.

Contents
1 game board printed on both sides (farm/city)
5 magnifying glasses
19 decorations
30 search cards “farm” (green backside)
30 search cards “city” (blue backside)
1 hour-glass
1 die with symbol
1 set of game instructions

39507.name: Planet der Sinne: Fühlen
boardgamefamily: HABA Planet der Sinne (Sensory Planet) series
39507.description:
A collection of educational games by the HABA editors. Games include assembling jigsaw puzzles blindfolded, matching tactile cards only by touch, and identifying traced shapes by touch.

Contents:

1 "Suzy Velvet Paw" figure
1 game board
20 tactile cards
2 four-part jigsaws
1 bag
1 blindfold
20 wooden animals (4 each: hedgehogs, frogs, fish, cows, wolves)
1 die
1 poster
instructions
sensory information leaflet

39508.name: G4
39508.description:
An educational game to be used in a classroom environment, published in Flanders. The aim is to learn about city government and local politics.
A cityscape is built up out of roads and buildings. The buildings are sheets of thick paper that are placed upright with plastic stands.
Pupils are members of the city council, representing one of four parties. They must gain votes (represented by meeples) by answering questions on politics in Flanders, and by having their party projects accepted by a council majority.

39509.name: Starfall Speedway Game
39509.description:
From the Publisher's Description:

This is more than a simple board game. It contains 2 complete games, which can easily be tailored to your child's reading or pre-reading level. Beginning readers can learn their ABCs driving on Starfall Alphabet Avenue, and learn to read short-vowel words and high-frequency words while racing on the Starfall Speedway. Children start with letter names and sounds, and then progress to reading words, producing rhymes, or using words in simple sentences. Both games easily grow with your child's expanding literacy skills, and foster a love of reading that lasts a lifetime. You will be amazed that learning to read can be so much fun!

This exceptional game set is packaged in a sturdy, colorful box, and includes a large 2-sided game board, 3 decks of high-quality Starfall Phonics Skill Cards, a spinner, and 8 race-car playing pieces. Instructions in English, Spanish, French and Chinese are included.

39510.name: Raise The Ruins
39510.description:
In Raise the Ruins, players are priests, fresh from their trials in the Temple of Favors. Many of Azytecal's once great temples stand on the cusp of ruin, the voices of the faithful no longer echoing throughout their halls, and the altars lay barren. Restoring these temples is the object of Raise the Ruins.

Players vie for the blessings of the three deities and send their followers to the forgotten altars bearing offerings. Raise the Ruins is a card driven set collection game with easy to grasp mechanics and engaging game play decisions for 3-4 players, Ages 10 and up, and plays in 45-60 minutes.

Components:
52 Offering Cards
8 Trophy Cards
12 Temple Cards
3 Deity Cards and 3 Wooden Deity Markers
2 Wooden Crest Markers
4 Favor Cards
24 Wooden Followers (6 in each color)
4 Score Cards & Wooden Markers

________________________________

Raise The Ruins will be available later this month in standard Small Box Games limited print run. Additionally, a add on pack will be available for those already owning TEMPLE. A downloadable version of the board for TEMPLE will also be available for downloading, and, in conjunction with the rules already available online, playing TEMPLE will be possible with a copy of Raise The Ruins

39511.name: Finger Soccer
39511.description:
From the publisher's website:

In the tradition of paper football played by millions of kids, both young and old, Zelosport has taken this same concept to the most popular sport around the world! Finger Soccer allows fans to take this great game indoors to the kitchen table where families can enjoy many more hours of entertainment, day or night, rain or shine!

39512.name: Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Palermo Marina
39512.description:
This is a Formula Dé track available for free download online - created by Alessandro Crespi.
It is a course based on Palermo City (Italy, Sicily).
You will race near Tirrenum Sea at the Marina.
This is part of a track series called ITALY SERIES.

01. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Bologna Centro
02. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Roma Colosseo
03. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Roma Isola Tiberina
04. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Milano Castello Sforzesco
05. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Bologna Stadio Dall'Ara
06. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Palermo Marina
07. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Trieste Porto
08. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Agrigento Valle dei Templi
09. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Torino Centro
10. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Firenze Lungo Arno
11. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Commemorative Track
12. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Misano, Santa Monica

39513.name: Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Trieste Porto
39513.description:
This is a Formula Dé track available for free download online - created by Alessandro Crespi.
It is a course based on Trieste City (Italy, Friuli Venezia Giulia).
You will race near Adriaticum Sea at the City Dock.
This is part of a track series called ITALY SERIES.

01. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Bologna Centro
02. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Roma Colosseo
03. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Roma Isola Tiberina
04. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Milano Castello Sforzesco
05. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Bologna Stadio Dall'Ara
06. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Palermo Marina
07. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Trieste Porto
08. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Agrigento Valle dei Templi
09. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Torino Centro
10. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Firenze Lungo Arno
11. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Commemorative Track
12. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Misano, Santa Monica

39514.description:
GALAXY OF D
A TWO Players hex & counter space combat game
Fast, brutal and diceless combat !

The galaxy is randomized at the beginning of each game, so no two games are the same ! And you will constantly try to outthink your opponent (in a fun way, in our experience :) )
The game length is about 45-90 minutes (depends on the players). In the gameplay Galaxy of D uses almost no dice/randomizer of any kind, I think this is a very Euro game. Bad moves, and the game can end in 15-30 minutes!

1. INTRODUCTION
Once again, the Redog (red) and the Cynder (blue) come face to face to conquer a galaxy…the Galaxy of D !!
You are a space war commander who controls a small fleet of ships on the Redog/Cynder side. You spend money to buy ships, then you can move ships around to attack other ships and enemy Starbases. Also, you can take control of planets and asteroids by moving your ships to their sectors. Holding planets and asteroids is important because this gives you a steady income that can be used to buy more ships, but keep in mind that your enemy is going to be competing with you for those same resources.
If you move a Freighter to a planet, it automatically acquires cargo. Once a Freighter has cargo, you can sell it to the Spaceport. Each Freighter can carry one cargo and only Freighters can carry cargo. Just watch out for those pirates!
One last thing. In an act of sabotage, someone turned on your Starbase’s self-destruct mechanism. This means that it will gradually destroy itself, assuming that your enemies don’t eliminate you first. Really, you have no time to waste. Get to it, commander!

2. THE MISSION
Your goal is to eliminate your enemy’s Starbase while protecting your own.

Home Page: http://www.jackdgames.com
39514.name: Galaxy of D

39515.description: At first, players take turns to grow the board from hex tiles and fill it with their pawns. Then they seek to be the last one standing while the board shrinks.
39515.name: Limit

39516.description:
This expansion for Deukalion consists of three vortex tiles that can be placed on a space near the edge of the gameboard, allowing for instantaneous travel but at the potential cost of some of your crew.

It has been a free gimmick at the Essen fair 2008.
39516.name: Deukalion: Whirlpool of the Charybdis

39517.description: This expansion for Deukalion brings the Greek hero Theseus into the game, where he can serve as a powerful warrior on your ship, fighting twice as well as normal figures. Just watch out for opponents poaching him for their own crews.
39517.name: Deukalion: Theseus – Conqueror of the Minotaur

39518.description:
This small expansion adds three special victory point cards (4, 2 and 1 point) to the game.
A player can get the highest available card if he has at least one of any sort of potion cards.
39518.name: Wie verhext!: Der brodelnde Theriak

39520.description:
This is an expansion for "Mensch Ärgere Dich Nicht" (Pachisi, Aggravation). It adds more possibilities to this classic game. Instead of rolling the dice you can play a card. The cards can dramatically change the game.

Expands:

Pachisi
39520.name: Ärger Dich schwarz!

boardgamedesigner: Drakes, Jarvis, Walsh, and Gluck, Ltd.
39521.name: The Magro Game
39521.description: From the box "The International shipping game for 3 to 6 players. You win The Magro Game by becoming the wealthiest shipowner afloat. Which is far from easy. To prosper in this game you'll have to be successful at outbidding your opponents for the most lucrative cargoes, quick at working out the most profitable routes, and adroit at running your fleet in the most efficient way. None of which is very far removed from the real thing. But then, that's what The Magro Game is all about."

39522.name: Joc de la Festa Major
39522.description:
The celebration of Vilafranca is annual and is typical of Catalonia.In the 1994 they published this game to collect money.
The game is similar to game of goose but acclimated in the celebration.

39523.name: Gold Rush The Prospectors Game
39523.description:
This is a very simple game in which the players take turns spinning a 6-sided teetotum, each spin determining the distribution of the 10 "gold nuggets" that come with the game.

The contents of the game are the metal teetotum, nuggets, rulebook with a very short history of the California gold rush, and a canvas pouch to hold it all.

Teetotum has sides T1, T2, TA, P1, ? and ?.

39524.name: Spite 'N' Malice
39524.description: This is a 2-deck, 2-player version of Spite and Malice with cards Ace through King, rather than Ace through Queen. The jokers are also excluded. It is very similar to Skip-Bo.

39525.name: Bakugan Attack
39525.description:
Unleash the power of Bakugan in a fun, fast-paced card game for the whole family!

Challenge your friends and family to a fast-paced game of Bakugan Attack! This easy to learn card game has all the heroes and action of the Bakugan Battle Brawlers tv show. Roll the dice to determine how many Bakugan to catch. Use your strategy and special cards at the right time to knock out your opponents. Use the power of your cards wisely to change the game around to your advantage. Get the correct amount of Bakugan cards to win. The power is in your hands!

39526.name: Le Cadran de Kaplan
39526.description:
First you put 12 cards in a circle on the board and 6 cards in the middle. Cards are chosen in accordance with symbols on there backs. On the other side there is a letter or a space for cards on the circle, and a clue for cards in the middle. Letters will make a word 6 to 12 letters long. You don't know where the beginning and the end of the word are. You must find it as fast as possible. More than 400 current French words are available.

The most impressive in this game is that the game itself creates the word! All players can play together to find it, including the player who put the cards on the board in the first place.

Each player rolls 3 d12. The roll indicates which cards are available for auction. Players can put on a card a token face back (values of those tokens are from 1 to 9).

When 3 tokens are put on a card, the value of the token is shown. The player with the highest value can look at the card.

In a second part of the game some cards are shown to all the players. Winning auctions allows the player to look for a clue card.

When a player thinks they have discovered the word he/she writes it on a paper. At the end of the game, the word is revealed. Players win victory points in accordance with the earliest correct deduction.

39527.description: The board and pieces resemble those Danish building blocks, allowing the players to produce a randomized board for each game. Take turns to place your blocks around the symbols to score points, and block the other players out.
39527.name: Block Buster

39528.name: Kumbuka
39528.description:
Kumbuka is a collection of different games using the tile set in different ways. The games are mostly for young children and encourage thinking and memory skills.

The games are; Pairs, Guess The Animal, Animal Caravan, Animal Party.

The fantastic art on the tiles is derived from the work of Edward Saidi Tingatinga, who drew his inspiration from the local cave art in Tanzania. Helvetas is a Swiss charitable group that supports artists in a workshop in Dar im Salaam producing Tingtinga work.

39529.name: Ying Yang
39529.description:
Ying Yang, subtitled: "A Game of Strategy for ages 8 to Adult, Game for Two", produced in Springfield, Oregon.

From the BACK of the box:

Object of the Game:
"To participate in moving the place markers ('pawns') across the board until one player is successful in moving his place marker into his winning corner."

Contents:

The box of which contains the instructions on the back of that.
An illustrative tri-folded half-sheet of examples of plays.
2 Sets consisting with a red or green pawn and matching 4-d6.
A Ying Yang vacuform shallow tray/board to conduct playings upon with this.

39530.name: Element
39530.description:
By using various elements (glass stones) and their corresponding properties, players try to surround their opponents wizard so that they are unable to make any further moves.

At the beginning of each turn 4 dice are rolled that will tell you which elements you can add to the board. Special element properties correspond to placing the element stones. At any time during during their turn, a player can move their wizard. Players can only move their own Wizard piece but elements can be controlled by either player.

39531.name: Follow That!
39531.description:
From the back of the box:

Prepare yourselves! An exciting contect is about to begin, and the arena is yours. The challenge? FOLLOW THAT!, a pastime almost as amusing for spectators as it is the players in the fray.

A word game which tests your reflexes and your memory, FOLLOW THAT! contains 600 categories covering just about every subject under the sun.

EXAMPLE: The subject is Popular Movie Quotes. Someone calls out "Frankly my dear, I don't give a damn" - if you follow up with "probably the best lager in the world" - you'll get the thumbs down for using a non sequitur, (something that simply doesn't follow).
If you'd said "Make my day" you'd be laughing.

A truly democratic game for three or more players (the more the merrier), the idea of FOLLOW THAT! is to stay in the fray and score more!

For 3 or more players Age 7 to adult.

39532.name: Génies en herbe
39532.description:
A trivia board game based on the popular TV show "Génies en herbe". (aired on Société Radio-Canada)

Has many of the same mechanics of the TV show.

Covering many fields of knowledge and containing over 3500 questions written by one of the TV judges.

Content:
1 board game
1 black cards holder
6 divider cards
1 dice
1 Rulebook
1 box with 750 question cards
10, 20 and 100 points money bills
1 hiding-card
6 playing tokens

Game goal:
Victory goes to the first player to reach the agreed upon point limit (ex: 300 points, 500 points).

39533.name: "Canberra visitor" a game about our National Capital
39533.description:
"Canberra visitor" The Capital board game

This game is intended to provide an enjoyable and stimulating way of learning about Australia's National Capital. It is also an effective medium for teaching, learning and practising a range of skills.

The board is based on a scale map of the city showing its geographical features, the major road system and the location of 40 places of interest.

Players move tokens along a road system, determining their rate of progress by trying to avoid strategically placed penalty spots and chance spots.

Sketches and detailed information of the 40 places are given on large playing cards and players are exposed to daily life situations in the capital through the use of chance cards.

Detailed instructions for 4 games, each of increasing complexity are clearly presented in a small booklet.

39534.name: Ruby Gloom: The Game
39534.description:
From the publisher:

Goal of the Game - Each player replaces the 6 cards one has according to the rules, and the player with the lowest sum of numbers in the 6 cards will be winner of the round. The winner of the round get a point chip. The first who get 3 point chips will be a winner of the game.

Game Contents - 52 cards (4 colors with 11 cards for each, 4 special cards, 4 moon cards), 15 point scoring beads

The game uses the license from a popular Canadian cartoon, Ruby Gloom, happiest girl in the world.

Recommended Ages 7 and up

39535.name: New World Disorder: CyberZone
39535.description:
Cyberzone is a cybernetic rules add-on for New World Disorder (2E), the easy-to-learn, miniatures-based tabletop game that takes place in a very near and very dystopian future.

Enter the CyberZone, a prison for the hordes of illegally-mechanized citizens that once plagued the outside world. These freaks are even more deadly than the crews that battle it out for control in Angel City. The residents of the CyberZone take advantage of the power that their cybernetics provide—from stronger limbs and better vision to mounted weapons and sub-dermal armor. Embrace the metal!

Available in PDF format and as a Printed Set with full-color paper miniatures.

Expands:

New World Disorder (2E)

39536.name: Cat & Fish
39536.description:
The board is a hex grid with an island in the center, and sea surrounding. Set the game up by randomly placing fish tiles into the seas, with more valuable fish placed closer to the island (different colored tile backs). Each player starts with a fishing rod and 5 Curo (Cat Euro). The game starts in Spring; play through till Winter.

Each season, players first use their 2 workers (3 in some circumstances) to choose actions from a common board, in turn order. Then, in turn order, execute any of your actions (removing worker from board). The actions allow you to move your cat from the island to other sea hexes, buy/sell fish, buy special cards that improve your ability to move or fish or give you new abilities, move obstacles around the board, etc. Each player may only store 2 fish (until additional storage purchased), and different types of fish fetch different prices depending on the season. At the end of Spring, you replenish fish on the board. At the end of Winter, pay a "Union Fee".

The game ends after the 5th Winter. The player with the most money wins!

39538.name: Zombies Want Fluffy
39538.description:
Zombies Want Fluffy™ is an exciting two-player head-to-head board game where shambling undead horrors meet Fluffy, the adorable family dog. Each game takes 20 to 60 minutes to play, and features a tense, surprise-filled chase mechanic.

The story thus far... Fluffy has had a lot to drink and is looking to “visit” a tree on his way home late one night. And he’s found his mark -- a beautiful, secluded tree right there in the back corner of the cemetery. Unbeknownst to poor Fluffy, the cemetery is filled with man-eating, er..., dog-eating zombies who just woke up for a midnight snack. Fluffy is gonna be that snack if the shambling menaces having anything to say about it. Can you help Fluffy race to freedom (and relief!) before his bladder explodes or he becomes zombie chow?

A serious game is at the heart of this absurd premise.

39539.description:
This 12-scenario pack was released by Fanatic Enterprises to utilize the new armies made available by the ASL module Armies of Oblivion. The scenarios all include armor and the armies of Bulgaria, Croatia, Romania, Hungary or Slovakia.

FE 116 Bad Neighbor Policy: A small scenario set on boards 3 and 49. The scenario features a March 1939 border action featuring a small Slovakian combined arms force attacking a small Hungarian force. This is nice tourney sized scenario.

FE 117 Sanok Action: This scenario is set on boards 48 and 2. This is a medium sized scenario set in the opening days of Barbarossa. The scenario features a dug in Russian force holding off a German-Slovakian force that needs to capture some pillboxes.

FE 118 Zaporhze Island: This is another tourney scenario set on boards 47 and 8. Some dug in Russian defenders defend a stream crossing and try to hold some buildings against a infantry armor Hungarian force.

FE 119 The Face of War: During the Crimea Campaign, this scenario features the Rumanians attacking some dug in Russians supported by late arriving armor. This scenario is set on boards 19 and 16. This is your typical attack counterattack situation.

FE 120 Nasty Business: Much of the time Axis Minor troops were performing security services. This scenario set on boards 19 and 49 features a small partisan screening force attempting to delay rear echelon Slovakian troops from attacking the buildings on board 49 from a force of partisans set up on 49. This is a medium sized scenario.

FE 121 Allies in a Few Days: This one is set on boards 40 and 42. This is a meaty scenario featuring a river crossing with a twist. A dug in Russian force tries to keep a Rumanian force from crossing the river but the twist is that the Rumanians have troops popping out of the ether behind their lines. This action represents a situation where the Russians had broken through the Rumanian lines and reached a river. The Rumanian 1st Armored Division was tasked with counterattacking but the Russians were still dealing with bypassed units.

FE 122 Slovakian Slugfest: This one is set on boards 40 and 50. The Germans are attempting to squash the Slovakian Uprising. The Germans are attacking down these boards against Slovakian armor and infantry supported by partisans. Some unique set up conditions give this good replay value.

FE 123 Enemies All Around: The Bulgarians show up in this scenario. A small rear echelon German unit is surrounded. The Bulgarians have to destroy their vehicles. This scenario is set on boards 24 and 50.

FE 124 Paulis Detachment: This is a very meaty scenario featuring the Hungarians fighting the Rumanians on boards 49 and 22. A dug in Rumanian force tries to hold off an strong Hungarian attack.

FE 125 Lessons Learned the Hard Way: Here is a quick playing tourney scenario set on board 48. A small German force sets up HIP and tries to ambush a Bulgarian Reconnaissance unit. This should be a good one for lots of play with a great deal of replay potential.

FE 126 Path to Retribution: The Yugoslavian armored brigade shows up in this one as they try to catch and destroy a German/Croatian combined arms force. This meaty scenario is set on boards 41 and 49.

FE 127 Junkyard Wars: This scenario features the Bulgarian Armored Regiment attacking a force of Germans. Both sides get substantial armor and this is a meaty scenario. This scenario is set on boards 16 and 48
39539.name: The Oblivion Pack

39540.name: Blotto
39540.description:
From the game tube:

Blotto is a Party Game
Play it with as many people as can fit around the giant Vinyl Board.

Blotto is a Drinking Game
You drink is used as he actual playing piece.

Blotto is a Fast Moving Strategy Game
Quick to learn with noise-makers provided to hurry slowpokes.

Blotto is a Party Starter."

Think of Quoridor played with drinks? You are trying to move your drink to the temperance zone, last one to make it there has to drink. You have Blocks you can put up to slow your opponents down.

39541.name: Lion Country
39541.description: Lion Country is a Monopoly-esque game produced as a fundraiser for the Centre County Medical Society Auxiliary in 1983 by CPM Associates. In this game, you acquire and expand franchises. It uses the typical roll & move mechanic of Monopoly, but rather than buying groups of properties, you can expand almost any property by purchasing franchise discs thus expanding it. It has a single chance-like card deck. It is called Lion Country after Penn State's mascot.

39542.name: Frantic Frogs
39542.description: In this game you hit a 'leaf' (plastic 'flipper') which catapults your magnetic frog up a stem to try and collect metal 'bug' discs while your opponents are doing the same. It's a race to see who can finish with the most 'bugs'.

39543.name: Jeu des boucles
39543.description:
A set of 36 cardboard tiles featuring numerous paths on each, and 4 borders with ending loops.

Up to 6 players compete to build the largest loop.

The rules are close to Tantrix, but the tiles are identical to those found in the recent game Tsuro.

39544.description:
Springtime has come. The animals wake up in search of food. The players are forest keepers and have to protect the animals from the poachers. The poachers have hiding places, but to catch the animals they have to come out of their hiding places and can be catched. You have to work together to surround and catch them.

Every turn has 4 parts:
1. All poachers move by rolling one colour-dice. Green makes them go through the woods to the next hiding place, red through the fields and blue by boat over the water.
2. The forest keepers move one step at a time. From a flower field to a forest and vice versa. You can make an extra step if an area is already guarded.
3. You wake up two animals, they will come out of their dens, the place where you put them on the board. Ducks go into the water, boars to the forest next to the den and deers to the flower fields.
4. You may move one duck, one boar and one deer to the next area. Each area has only enough food for one animal.

Game end
When the last poacher is caught, you have won!
You lost if one animal is cought by a poacher, or if an animal has not enough food.
39544.name: Stop de Stropers

39545.description:
Reconquista! is a two-player simulation of the Christian reconquest of Iberia from the Muslim Moors. One player directs the Islamic Caliphate, the other an assortment of not always cooperative Christian kingdoms. Each turn represents 25 years. Play starts in 850, when the Christian advance began in earnest, through 1250, by which time the outcome was inevitable.

The game includes an area movement map and 200+ counters representing Andalusians, North African jihadist forces (Almohades and Almoravides), Frankish, Catalan, Aragonese, Asturias/Leon, Castilians, Portuguese, Military Orders (Templars, Santiago, etc.) and Christian Crusaders. The Christian player controls the Christian kingdoms except when a "War among infidels" event gives the Islamic player control of one Christian kingdom's units for that turn. The Frankish units are generally neutral, but the Islamic player can try to activate them via random events (simulating the assorted wars between the Frankish and Aragonese kingdoms, especially during the XIII century).

Special rules cover noted leaders such as Al-Mansur and El Cid, North African invasions, the Taifa Kingdoms, independence of Portugal and Castille, rebellions, viking raids, and the St. James sepulchre.
39545.name: Reconquista !

39546.name: Give and Take
39546.description:
From the designer:

"Give and Take is a board game one can learn in a few minutes, although mastering it may take a little longer... like a lifetime.

Simplicity and elegance with diabolical plotting and incredible depth of thought make this game worth trying.

This may be the only board game one may win even when trailing way behind.

A combination of chess, checkers and backgammon principles with a unique way of sacrificing pieces for position, Give and Take is destined to withstand the test of time."

Players start with sixteen pieces that can move one space forward or to the side, but never backwards. Pieces are captured by jumping and if a piece can capture another, it must (like ZERTZ).

If a piece advances to the opponent's edge of the board, it becomes a King and can now move any number of spaces in a single orthagonal direction. Also, if a player only has one piece remaining, that piece automatically becomes a king.

The winner is the player who captures all of his/her opponent's pieces.

39547.name: Sieben
39547.description:
Cards have a number (1-7) at the top, and a hole at the bottom. Each player starts each round with 7 cards. The starting player plays a card face up to the discard pile. In turn order, players discard a card directly on top of the discard pile, either playing hole-on-hole or hole-on-number. The sum of visible numbers must be equal to or greater than the previous sum, but no higher than 7.
- If you cannot play, take a penalty card -- turn over.
- If you discard a card and the sum is not 7, draw a card -- play passes to next clockwise player.
- If the sum is 7, set aside that discard pile and start a new one by playing another card -- your turn is over (do not draw a card).
If a new draw pile is needed, shuffle all cards already set aside.

When a player runs out of cards (plays their last card creating a sum of 7), they take 1 VP chip + 1 chip per player remaining. Play continues until only 1 player is left with cards.

With 2-4 players, the game ends after 7 rounds; with 5-7 players, play till the VP chips have all been handed out. The player with the most VP wins!

39548.name: Världsrekord
39548.description: An old game about athletics where the placers compete with eachother in up to 16 different sports, such as e.g. highjumping, racing, javelin and high jump.

39549.name: Destination Hogwarts
39549.description:
Destination Hogwarts is the fast moving Harry Potter game that will take you on a journey through Hogwarts School of Witchcraft & Wizardry and the surrounding grounds! As a student you will visit famous destinations in and around Hogwarts collecting House Points as you go, whilst trying to avoid the hazards along the way. Players 2-8, Ages 8+

One of many in the "Destination" series.

39550.name: Missúmdàlikoi
39550.description:
Missúmdàlikoi is a large-unit, board war game set on M.A.R. Barker's world of Tékumel. It was published in Volume 2, Issue 1 of Seal of the Imperium, a publication of Zottola Publishing, Inc. (www.zotpub.com). The rules for the game appear on pages 132-199 of that issue.

Rules for two scenarios are included: a two-player Salarvyáni offensive into Tsolyánu and a 2-4 player Tsolyáni invasion of Salarvyá.

39551.name: Song of the Dwarf Lords
39551.description: Players represent Dwarven nobles. Each turn you will attempt to win honor by giving the most money in the Contest of Gifts. The winner of the Contest also gets first pick of the opportunities available for that year; lands that can increase your wealth, magical items, buildings and quests. You must manage your gold carefully and evaluate the relative value of the opportunities based on the stage of the game and what you and your opponents have already developed.

39552.description: It’s a 4-quarter smash-mouth football game where you roll the dice to march 100 yards down the field. But standing between you and the goal line are sacks, penalty flags, and costly turnovers. Score touchdowns, field goals, and 2 point conversions – go for it on 4th down if you have to! It’s lightning fast gridiron action for football fans of all ages!
39552.name: GoLong Football Dice Game

39553.description:
Chaos Campaign rules provides an open-ended campaign framework that easily allows gamemasters and players to use a variety of published-tracks to create their own unique gaming experiences using forces of their own creation. Each track that plugs into the Chaos Campaign rules system (there are no tracks found in this Chaos Campaign book which is a free download) provides a backstory that fits into the overall campaign plot. Likewise, each track is set up as a general framework to assist gamemasters and players in creating the opposing forces and adding other battlefield effects specific to that track. In addition, using the Warchest Point System, player groups may choose what direction the campaign takes.

The Chaos Campaign rules are designed to allow players to customize campaigns from the Jihad Series of Scenario books and a new set of campaign books designed specifically for the Chaos Campaign system.

The books in this series are:

Jihad Turning Points: Luthien fleshes out the details of the conflict surrounding this pivotal world published in various Jihad Plot Sourcebooks. Additionally, players can join one of the myriad of units fighting for control—and survival—of the Combine’s capital world. Enemies from within and without seek to cut off the Dragon’s head, while loyal samurai fight to save it.




Further books are expected to be released in the coming year.

Expands:

Classic Battletech: Total Warfare
Classic Battletech: Tactical Operations
39553.name: Battletech: Chaos Campaign

39555.name: Treasure Chase
39555.description:
The game's designer emailed me a description of the game as follows:

"It’s a game of pirates, adventure, skill and skulduggery. In essence it’s a race to find the X square and discover the location of the hidden treasure. Along the way you have to collect eight various items to aid you in your expedition, but also look out for all the things which can trip you up and tunnels that can aid you in your search.

Treasure chase is a whole lot of fun with just a little element of strategy thrown in and is designed for the whole family to play almost anywhere – as there is no board. You just need a flat surface and up to 4 willing pirates!

Next year we intend to release the garden size version - perfect for the out door and the beach." This was emailed today 19 Nov 08 and so "next year" would mean 2009.

39556.name: BalaGwari
39556.description: This is a modern Manqala game with two rows of four pits each. Players start with 4 seeds in each pit and own the pits on the player's side of the board but this is one of the rare manqala games in which pieces are distinguishable, i.e., one player starts with white seeds and the other black. Sowing is anticlockwise starting in the pit adjacent to the starting pit and sowing one seed in each pit until the last seed is sown, without restriction on laps and sowing in the original pit if a sufficient number of seeds are in the original pit. Captures occur when the last seed is sown in an empty pit. That last seed and all seeds in the pits opposite it are captured. The winner is the player to capture more of the opponent's seeds and play continues until no more moves are possible.

39557.name: Dawn of the Rising Sun Ship Forms
39557.description: 56 page booklet which includes a form for every ship class, including the Royal Navy ships, found in the data annex. All forms include both profile and deck plan. As a bonus, a CD will be provided with the information in PDF format so that it can be printed with ease.

39559.name: 1. FC Kaiserslautern: Das Gesellschaftsspiel für alle Fans der roten Teufel
39559.description:
This is a quizgame about the german football team 1. FCK. You have to answer questions on the 4 Masterball places to get the 4 cupcards. There are different actions on different places on the board, like changing your direction. A very unaspiring roll, move and answer questions game.
Interesting only for fans of the Red Devils (= 1.FC Kaiserslautern).

39562.name: Match 'N Stack Race Game
39562.description:
From the Box:

- Exciting three dimensional board game features molded plastic tiles with simple words and pictures.

- Great action as players "Match and Stack" word tiles on their own section of the board.

- Kids learn word, letters, objects, and test their memories all while having a good time!

boardgamehonor: 2010 Guldbrikken Best Adult Game Nominee
2010 Guldbrikken Best Adult Game Winner
39564.description:
Guessing facts about fellow players

Each round, a players reads a question and the three possible answers. He secretly selects his choice, and the other players simultaneous try to guess it. They bet 1 or 2 chips on their guess; correct answer doubles your bid, wrong loses it. The person questioned receives as many chips as there are correct guesses.

Each player starts with 10 chips, and the same total is used as the bank. The game ends when the bank breaks. Goal is to get most chips.

The questions have a very wide range. Some examples:
- How is your relationship with your father?
- When did you last laugh out loud?
- How many persons from the following list do you know: "Vera Lynn, Lee Harvey Oswald, Maria Callas"?
39564.name: ego

39565.description:
Using 3 Treehouse Sets from Looney Labs, 6 dice, and a world map color coded by Looney labs, be the first person to conquer another continent while maintaining a base in your own continent.

From the publisher- "If you grew up playing Risk and Diplomacy like we did, and you enjoyed these classic games but were frustrated because they took ALL DAY to play... we've got a game for you."

Also included in Pyramid Arcade.
39565.name: World War 5

39566.description:
The second collection of articles from White Dwarf for Warhammer 40,000 (the first was the Warhammer 40,000 Compendium). This book introduced the Grey Knights, Chaos Terminators, the modern Eldar (including Aspect Warriors and Craftworlds), Genestealer Cults and a few odds and ends to Rogue Trader.

This book signaled the direction the game and background was to take for the next several editions, including the current 5th edition.

Expands:
Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader
39566.name: Warhammer 40,000 Compilation

39567.description:
This little expansion only needs to be printed out and added on Formula D’s board. It adds a bit more chaos to a track already has more than its fair share. The "Shortcut" allows the driver to cut the corner short and potentially gain a big lead. Watch out though, the gates may not be open and you may let your competitor through instead!

Expands:

Formula D
39567.name: Formula D: The "Shortcut"

39568.name: Ground Zero
39568.description:
From the website:

"The Game that allows you to sense the hypocrisy of the New York Politician or the embrace what it means to stare treachery and adversity head on as a Rescue Worker. With the roll of each dice sense the tenacity of a First Responder, even while being used as a political pawn."

39569.name: Global Ody-See
39569.description:
Global Ody-See is a three-dimensional (3-D) travel game designed to teach people about the world, its natural features, nations, people and their culture. Our first version will be a traditional board game but it will be special in many respects. The game uses beautiful satellite imagery and players can choose to travel along realistic 3-D routes between places of interest using different transportation modes.

Watch it being played: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Dsx8nP6m0KY

39570.name: DragonRaid
39570.description:
DragonRaid

"The exciting new adventure for courageous Christians"

"DragonRaid is an exciting experience in adventure simulation. More than just a game, it offers hours of enjoyment while teaching participants to resist sin, counter deceptive arguments, memorize Scripture, and build moral and spiritual character."

Includes two battle boards, rule booklets, adventure booklets, cardboard character pawns, tokens, score sheets, and two "special" polyhedral dice.

Ages 12 and up.

39571.name: To The Top
39571.description: To The Top is a game where you try to top a victory ascension chart through Bluffing, voting and Co-operation. Voting is the main form of ascension through the chart however more people voting for a single item can have adverse ascension consequences. Through moderate co-operation ascension is guaranteed.

39572.name: What belongs where?
39572.description:
A game derived from Picture Bingo featuring Playmobil toys. It takes the boards from Bingo, but the pieces are in puzzle-shapes. This adds the ability to try and recognize the overturned pieces from their shapes.

The rules include a variety of other games using the pieces included. This includes guessing and memory games.

39573.description:
From the back of the rules:

"The Vehicle Manual adds an exciting new dimension to your Warhammer 40,000 games. It updates and expands the vehicle rules from the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook, and allows you to use any of the model vehicles produced by Citadel Miniatures for Warhammer 40,000 in your games"

Along with the Battle Manual the precursor to Warhammer 40,000 2nd edition. Included a 32-page rulebook and 30 "Datafax" sheets for various vehicles in the game.

Also included the transparent "vehicle targeting grid" which was truly a unique piece of GW game development.

This was the last book for 1st edition.

Expands:
Warhammer 40,000: Rogue Trader
39573.name: Warhammer 40,000 Vehicle Manual

39574.name: Agente Secreto
39574.description:
A deduction and logic game.
Two countries have sent their best agents in a secrete mission. Your goal is to discover which mission and which agent was sent by the other player.

39575.name: 1808: Guerra de la Independencia
39575.description:
Components:
• One 18 x 24 map
• 192 Counter
• One Rulebook
• Two Scenarios

Time Scale: 10 days
Map Scale: 35 km.
Unit Scale: Division / Brigade

The Peninsular War is set in Spain and Portugal during the Napoleonic wars. Year: 1808.

The hex map represents a map of Spain and Portugal with most of the major towns and cities represented.

One player takes the role of the French whilst the other plays the allies (Britain, Spain and Portugal).

39576.name: Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Agrigento Valle dei Templi
39576.description:
This is a Formula Dé track available for free download online - created by Alessandro Crespi.
It is a course based on Agrigento a famous tourist place (Magna Grecia Temple Valley).
You will race near ancient Greek temples, inside history.

This is part of a track series called ITALY SERIES.

01. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Bologna Centro
02. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Roma Colosseo
03. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Roma Isola Tiberina
04. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Milano Castello Sforzesco
05. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Bologna Stadio Dall'Ara
06. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Palermo Marina
07. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Trieste Porto
08. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Agrigento Valle dei Templi
09. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Torino Centro
10. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Firenze Lungo Arno
11. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Commemorative Track
12. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Misano, Santa Monica

39577.name: Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Torino Centro
39577.description:
This is a Formula Dé track available for free download online - created by Alessandro Crespi.
It is a course based on Torino City (Italy).
You will race near Mole Antonelliana and ancient Castles inside the city.

This is part of a track series called ITALY SERIES.

01. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Bologna Centro
02. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Roma Colosseo
03. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Roma Isola Tiberina
04. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Milano Castello Sforzesco
05. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Bologna Stadio Dall'Ara
06. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Palermo Marina
07. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Trieste Porto
08. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Agrigento Valle dei Templi
09. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Torino Centro
10. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Firenze Lungo Arno
11. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Commemorative Track
12. Formula Dé: ITALY SERIES – Misano, Santa Monica

39579.name: Prospect
39579.description: In this Gold Rush game, your job is to make more money than the other players by prospecting new claims, mining their gold and selling it in town. You can hire gunmen to help protect your claims, or use them to jump claims belonging to other players instead. There are six different activities every turn (mine, claim jump, prospect, sell, hire, and draw), but you may only take three actions per turn. There is some strategy involved, but also a little luck because you never know how much gold you will find in the mines or whether the dice will roll in your favor.

39580.name: Swordsmiths of Spain
39580.description:
The Prince of Castile has announced his desire to obtain the finest sword in his kingdom. You are one of the famed swordsmiths of 16th century Toledo, and challenged to meet the prince's impeccable taste.
He demands the rarest metals, the most precious gems, and the finest leathers. There is little time, but you must purchase all the necessary raw materials, forge new and unique metals, and finally construct the most prestigious sword the world has ever seen. Do you have what it takes?

Swordsmiths of Spain is an innovative auction game that will have you asking for "just one more turn." Countless combinations of Metal, Gem, and Leather Cards keep the game fresh each time you play. What's more, you can combine Metals to forge entirely new alloys, including the elusive Eastern Soul Steel.

39581.name: Citizen X
39581.description:
Citizen X takes place at the beginning of the 20th century in a small city east of the Urals.
Due to an avalanche all citizens were separated from civilization.
To make matters worse a horrible vision came true. Zombies attacking during the night reduce the number of decent citizens.
Does the attorney solve this mystery? Time works against the citizens.

The role of the moderator is played by a DVD.

Includes:
- Rules
- DVD
- 32 cards (16 characters, 16 weapons)

At the beginning of the game each player starts with a character and a weapon.
Similar to Werewolves game roles are called, but not by a game master, by the DVD.
During night all characters have their eyes closed. Due to this players learn information about each other. Zombies try to overwhelm other characters.
After this the day phase starts. The large group separates into groups of two that can exchange info with trustworthy people. Clever negotiation is important.

39582.name: The Sword in the Stone Game
39582.description:
A childrens game designed by the Walt Disney corporation published by Whitman based on the Disney story of the Sword in the stone. The gameboard has a disc under the play area that can be moved with the finger so that the colors on the paths on the board change.Movement is done by s spinner. The object of the game is to pick up a sugar bowl,a squirrel, a bird and a fish in different areas of the play board. Then race toward the sword and when you pick that up you are the winner.
When you land on a red dot(the position of the dots change by turning the disc under the play field you have to spin the location spinner and you are send to that location....

39583.name: RisiKo! express
boardgamefamily: RisiKo!: Risk variations by Spartaco Albertarelli
39583.description:
Conquer the World with 8 dice and 25 Minutes!

There are 4 tanks in the player's color.
There is a plastic board with 15 spaces to place the dice.
Roll the (8) dice to conquer the continents.
Each continent has a value from 100 (Australia) to 500 points (Asia).
If you completed the conquest of a continent with the tanks in your color, roll the special (3) dice to gain bonus points.

That's all.
The first player to reach 10,000 points wins the game.

39584.name: Poltergeist
39584.description: A non-player hides little playing pieces in stacks of two hollow cubes. Children pick up stacks and shake them to find the playing pieces. Whoever finds most is the winner.

39585.name: Presidential Scrabble Democrats vs. Republicans Board Game
39585.description:
In the classic Scrabble word game, players use their seven drawn letter-tiles to form words on the gameboard. Each word laid out earns points based on the commonality of the letters used, with certain board spaces giving bonuses. But a word can only be played if it uses at least one already-played tile or adds to an already-played word. This leads to slightly tactical play, as potential words are rejected because they would give an opponent too much access to the better bonus spaces. (Description taken from the Scrabble entry).

This Presidential edition of Scrabble is based on the familiar classic but with several interesting twists. The letters and basic rules remain the same, but there are several important differences.
The board is round and not square.
All of the extra scoring spaces are replaced with the various states. They have two effects. The give the familiar triple letter or triple word scoring bonus. In addition each states gives an additional bonus equal to the state’s Electoral College value (after all other modifications). So for instance California is a triple letter space and gives a bonus of 55 points as well (it is also way off to one side).
There is a list of extra “words” that are worth extra points; either 5, 10 or 15 points. Some of these “words” are things like FDR or LBJ which would not ordinarily be available to use, while others are regular words like vote that just give an extra bonus.
Finally there is a deck of cards showing all of the Presidents. Each card has a bit of historical information and gives a way to either get an extra bonus when played or change the rules in some fashion. The Nixon card for instance allows one to play a word with one letter misspelled. Players receive five of these cards at the start of the game, and can play at most one per turn.

39586.name: Unconditional Surrender: The Battle of Fort Donelson, February 15, 1862
39586.description: Part of the War for Southern Independence Series, Unconditional Surrender is a brigade level simulation of the battle fought at Fort Donelson, Tennessee on February 15, 1862, specifically the Confederate failed attack to break out and escape from the surrounded fort.

39587.name: Machi
39587.description:
A small taste of Race for the Galaxy in medieval Japan, where each player must build and grow his village. To do this players have two types of cards, buildings and villagers.

The game lasts eight years after which the player with the most points wins.

39588.name: Fughedaboudit!
39588.description: This is a trivia game about organized crime, particular that which showed up on TV and in the movies. It later got some revamped rules (clarifications) and became Godfathers & Goodfellas - The Organized Crime Trivia Game. This game is much cheesier in appearance in a plane cardboard box with a crime boss mug printed on the front.

39589.description:
This game consists of two sub-games. In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Berlin-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.

This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game, journalists try to get the cover-story before the other players can by running up the stairs of the publisher trying to beat the others to his office.
39589.name: Stop-Over Berlin

39590.description:
Check out this XTRA great review for XTRA INNINGS!
http://www.amazon.com/Xtra-Innings-Action-Strategy-Basball/p...;showViewpoints=1Check out the great new XTRA INNINGS VIDEO right here !http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JJ754XL6Io4

NEW VIDEO FOR 2011 ! PLAY ALONG FOR 1/2 INNING WITH FRANK AND DWIGHT ! SEE HOW TO USE THE "PITCHING CHANGE". THE "PINCH HITTER". THE "HOME RUN" AND "SUPER CATCH" CARDS !
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QRtmsBHt278

FOLLOW XTRA INNINGS ON THEIR SPIFFY NEW FACEBOOK PAGE !
http://www.facebook.com/pages/Xtra-Innings-board-game/185521...

"XTRA INNINGS" is a great, new, rapid play board/card game which duplicates not only the strategy but also the pace and emotion of a real baseball game.
.Match wits with your opponent in a baseball card/board game that duplicates the classic confrontation between PITCHER and HITTER, or OFFENSE and DEFENSE. The PITCHING SEQUENCE is a "brain-teaser" - you choose every pitch and every base running play. No dice, no luck and no trivia - just you, your cards and the strategy and intensity of the great game of baseball. It's baseball chess with a touch of poker and a complete game, played by either two or four players, can be can be completed in less than two hours.

For younger and more novice players, the game also includes a "Little League Editon" It is a great way to learn all the basic plays before moving up to the Major Leagues. Hours of fun and educational too !

XTRA INNINGS - It's the National Pastime in a box! Play ball!
For more information, or to order the game, log on to www.xtrainningsgame.com.
To see how to play a half inning of the game, see the new slide show at http://www.xtrainningsgame.com/?p=48&;v=198727258948ee31d81c0503.57368139
39590.name: Xtra Innings

39591.name: One Piece's Thousand Sunny Treasure Search
39591.description: 2 players take turns rolling a pair of different colored dice (the dice are located inside the ship). Whoever matches the combination on the treasure map first wins the game.

39592.description:
Aces Over Hungary is a scenario and campaign book for the popular Check Your 6! Air Combat and Campaign Rules. The book provides two campaigns in one cover: the first 11 scenarios show the evolution of the US 15th Air Force’s strategic bombing campaign over Hungary during 1944; the next 12 scenarios recreate the intense combat between Hungarian and Soviet air forces as the Red Army overran Hungary in late 1944/1945. As well as covering events typical of the campaign (ground attack, reconnaissance, dogfights) the book also includes WWII’s top ace Erich Hartmann, Stuka-ace Hans-Ulrich Rudel’s Schlachtgeschwader 2, a rare 'balloon-busting' action, and unique prototype aircraft.

Historical Research: This book includes several introduction sections that contain campaign historical background, a campaign map plus a bibliography for further reading. Very little reliable information about the operations of the Hungarian air force in WWII is available in English. Professional Hungarian military aviation historian Csaba Becze fills this gap with sections covering the background to the campaign, the relative capabilities of the air forces involved and their weapons and tactics, the course of operations, and fascinating accurate details of each of the battles represented in the scenarios.

Aircraft Statistics: this book contains statistics for 27 aircraft featured in the campaign in aircraft statistics for Check Your 6!! .

Table of Contents


Campaign Introduction
Hungary Campaign Map
References and Recommended Reading
Hungarian Aces
The Protagonists - Hungary, Germany, USA, USSR
Axis and Allied Aircraft Statistics for Check Your 6!
Campaign Rules
Campaign Paragraphs
Scenarios (23)
39592.name: Check Your 6! Aces Over Hungary

39593.name: The Pillars of the Earth Medieval Challenge
39593.description:
"Immerse yourself in Ken Follett’s medieval world, which he created for his international bestseller The Pillars of the Earth. Build a model cathedral as the play progresses and answer questions on all facets of Medieval history, as well as a quiz on the book itself (optional).

The graphics are stunning and the gameplay completely engaging.

Contents: 1 Game board, 8 part Cathedral, 220 question cards, 50 William’s Choice cards, 4 playing pieces, 4 scoring tokens, 320 Stipend tokens, 1 die, I set rules."

39594.name: Eastern Panzer II
39594.description:
Eastern Panzer II is a turn-based tactical level wargame, set during 1943 to 1945 at the Eastern Front.

In Eastern Panzer II, players take command of their army and attempt to crush any opposition.

The game features simple rules, many types of units, is very compact, is fun, and most importantly, is free!

Eastern Panzer II will have updates and expansions, often with advanced rules and new units for the game.

Credits:
Counter art: A.Tan
Unit pictures: Dirk Schoenberger, Matt Fritz and Jon Oldham (www.juniorgeneral.org)
Rules and Instructions: A.Tan

39595.name: The New Zoo Revue
39595.description:
Billed as "the fun game that lets you explore your feelings & values", this TV show-inspired game seems to be in keeping with its Ungame ancestry. The goal of the game is nominally to collect a set of cards which match your "Winning Ticket", where the four types of cards correspond to the four main characters from "The New Zoo Review" (Freddie the Frog, Henrietta Hippo, Charlie the Owl, and their human friend Doug). However, the clear focus of the game is for the players (ideally children and their parents) to discuss various emotions and values in response to scenarios from the show described on the cards. For example, by landing on a Charlie the Owl space, the player may receive a card which reads:

Charlie is disappointed when his oil well isn't a big "money maker."
TELL ABOUT ONE OF YOUR DISAPPOINTMENTS.

One odd element of the game is the Gift Exchange spaces, which require a player landing on them to use a large spinner to select a "gift", which can vary from "if you have any cards, give one away" to "apologize to somebody for something" to "scratch someone's back for 15 seconds".

The game comes in a "Christian Version" which includes two pages of notes on how to enhance the religious education aspects of the game.

39596.description:
The Balloon Buster Expansion Set is a special kit for Wings of War miniatures, featuring a 1/144 scale Caquot - Ae800 balloon miniature (good for every nation at war) and an Allied Nieuport 16 with Le Prieur air-to-air rockets. Two versions of the kit are available, with different color schemes for both the balloon and for the airplane. Both include an assortment of decals to customize the balloon models. The twenty page rules booklet explains how to add balloons and Le Prieur rockets to your Wings of War battles, plus offers a number of exciting new missions so you can jump right in!

Part of the Wings of War series

See Also:

Wings of War: Miniatures
39596.name: Wings of War: Balloon Busters
boardgamefamily: Wings of Glory / Wings of War

39597.name: Bailén 1808
39597.description:
Wargame reproducing the Battle of Bailén (July,19 1808) of the War of Independence, Spain.

The wargame appears in the newspaper "El Pais" Supplement (June,21 1981).

Components:
• One 12 x 11" map
• 80 Counters
• One Rulebook
• One Scenario

Time Scale: 1h.

39598.name: La Guerra de la Independencia
39598.description:
The Peninsular War is set in Spain and Portugal during the Napoleonic wars. Years: 1808-1814

The hex map represents a map of Spain and Portugal with most of the major towns and cities represented.

Components:
• One 25 x 19" map
• 160 Counters
• One Rulebook
• Six Scenarios

Time Scale: 1 month
Map Scale: 30 km.
Unit Scale: Corp/Division/Brigade

39600.name: Pilgrim's Progress: The Game
39600.description:
An exciting new board game which shares the adventures and perils of Christian as he sets out on the journey of his life. On the road he meets terrifying monsters, horrible giants, a cruel judge, raging lions and scary dark places. But he also makes good friends and, at last, reaches journey's end - the Celestial City. Play the game and read the story in the book to help children learn the importance of this John Bunyan classic. (From Publisher)

Contents:

- 1 game board
- 1 giant die
- 1 packet of clear plastic stands
- 6 die-cut burden-bearing pilgrims
- 6 die-cut sword-bearing pilgrims
- 12 game board 3D characters
- 20 Pilgrim's Progress Cards
- 16 Pilgrim's Despair Cards
- 88 page Pilgrim's Progress illustrated storybook, which includes game rules.

39601.name: Mbelele
39601.description:
A manqala game.

From

http://www.wikimanqala.org/wiki/Mbelele:

"Mbelele is a very special mancala game. It is played by the Manga (or: Mba) in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. They live between Kisangani and Banalia and the game is played along the road that links Kisangani with Buta between kilometer 17 and 118. The Manga are the most southern Sudanese tribe in Upper Zaire.
The board, which measures about a meter, is made from the wood of the Kombo-Kombo (Musanga cecropioides). A beautiful Mbelele board is shown in the National Museum in Kinshasa since 1975.
What makes it a special game is the bizarre board and the fact that although there are two rows on the board, they are not shared by both players, as each plays only on his own row, making it one of the few two cycle games played on two rank boards. According to Townshend the game could also be regarded as a three-row mancala.

Rules:

The board (called mbele pápa) consists of two rows of 16 holes and four intermediate holes that are called teka. At the beginning of the game there are three seeds (Sing.: mbelele; Pl.: mbelese) in each hole. On his turn the player takes all the seeds of a hole belonging to his side and sows them in either direction in multiple laps, until he gets to an empty hole. If he reaches the last hole in his side he comes back.
If the last seed is sown in an empty hole opposite to a non-empty enemy hole, the opponent's seeds are captured.
If the move ends in any of the teka, the capture is made in the correspondent hole of the opponent.
A capture made with a singleton captures only a single seed.
It is not allowed to start a move from the last hole but one on the right, going to the right, if it contains only two seeds (he move would end in the same hole).
The winner is the player who captures all of the opponent's seeds. A draw is not possible."

39602.name: Moruba
39602.description:
A mancala game.

Source: http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Moruba

"Moruba (also Maruba) is a mancala game played by the Pedi (obsolete: Bapedi) in the South African provinces of Limpopo (mostly in the North Sotho speaking parts) and Mpumalunga in former Transvaal. Later, the game has been spread by mine workers to Gauteng. It is closely related to games described in Mozambique, e.g. Tchouba and Njombwa. The game was first researched in 1917 by the British ethnograph P. A. Wagner.

Moruba is traditionally played by men in the late afternoon in the shade of a tree. The game was used during war and was a social activity where men strategised about a variety of activities and events related to them, also shared advise and ideas. Language, expressions and terminology of the game signify what happens when war takes place. As women weren't allowed to go to war, they didn't play the game. In recent days, however, both genders began to play.

Starting in 2003, Moruba is promoted as an indigenous sport by the CSIR's National Product Development Centre and the South African Sports Commission (SASC). There were team and individual tournaments at the Indigenous Games Festival in Polokwane and the Indigenous Games Competition in Tzaneen. The game is also supported by the Mpumalanga Department of Sports, Recreation, Arts and Culture and the Department of Sport, Recreation, Arts and Culture of the Province Gauteng, because it forms an important expression of indigenous identity and, as it was said, of a "healthy life style". The best players, among them D. Shikwambam and Petrus Shibambu, are organized in Mindsports South Africa (MMSA).

This renaissance of African games is a response to Thabo Mbeki's call "to rediscover what was lost by indigenous people (of Africa through colonialism)".

Today the towns of Sasekani and Bolobedu are centers of the game. Strong clubs are also in Ka-Phalaborwa, Letaba, and Selwane. The newspaper Mopani News reports reguarly on Moruba competitions. The game which is already taught in the Bolobedu High School, will soon be introduced in all schools of Limpopo Province. Dickson Mpofu, the indigenous games co-ordinator in Mpumalanga, even wants to register Moruba with the Olympic committee.

Rules

The size of the game board often depends on the number of players. Most common are boards which have four rows of 12 holes (mekoti) each, but the number of holes can vary from four to 36 holes per row. The holes are dug into the earth. Each hole has two counters, usually pebbles or morula pips, which are called mathlapa ("cattle") or tinkhomo ("cow").

The game is played by two persons and sometimes by teams of up to six.

Each player (or team) only uses his side of the board.

On his turn a player takes the contents of one of his holes, which must contain at least two stones, and distributes them, one by one, counterclockwise into consecutive holes on his own side.

If the last stone falls into a non-empty hole, its contents are distributed in another lap in the same direction.

The move ends (kulala; literally "to sleep") when the last stone is dropped into an empty hole.

If the last stone falls into an empty hole of the inner row and the opposite hole of his opponent contains stones, these enemy stones are "killed" (tlaba) or "hit". Additionally, the stones in the hole of the same file in the outer row are "captured" (tlola). The killed or captured stones are removed from the board. The player is then entitled to capture the contents of any two other enemy holes.

When a player has only singletons, he is permitted to move them, but only in empty holes.

The player who has still stones at the end of the game is declared the winner. It is a draw, when the board position repeats without anything being captured. "

39603.name: Mefuvha
39603.description:
A mancala game. From: http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Mefuvha

Mefuvha ("foggy rain") ("foggy rain") is a mancala game of the Venda who are living in north-eastern South Africa. It is closely related to Moruba played in the same area by the Pedi and to games known by the Tonga in Mozambique, e.g. Tchouba and Njombwa. The game is played by men only, while women play Ndode, a game of dexterity.

Mefuvha is mentioned in old Venda legends such as the story of Sankhambi and the Baboons, which was written down by the British ethnologist Hugh Arthur Stayt in 1931.

In the rainy season it is strictly tabu to play the game with stones, for fear that the rain will be turned to hail; fruit pips are used instead. Moreover, it is prohibited to play the game after sunset because this would provoke cattle theft. The symbolic meanings of the game are athmospheric conflict and cattle-raiding.
Mefuvha Board

Mefuvha is played on solid wooden boards made from the trunk of a tree that can measure two meters and longer. Stayt observed boards up to 28 holes per row. The game was thus regarded to be the largest mancala game until it was reported in 1971 that Nsolo is played on bigger boards (up to 4x36 holes). Since 1995, Tchouba is known to be even larger (up to 4x40 holes).

The name of the game has often been misspelled as Mefuhva.
Rules:

Mefuvha is played on a board with an equal even number of square holes in each of the four rows from six to twenty-eight in a row, the usual number being between sixteen and twenty.

The holes contain two seeds except the leftmost hole of each player's inner row, which is empty, and the holes adjacent to them in the inner rows, which have just one seed.

Otherwise, the rules are identical to Moruba.

39604.name: Mwambulula
39604.description:
A mancala game. From http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Mwambulula:

"Mwambulula of the Bemba near Kasama in northern Zambia. The game was first described in Europe in 1956 by J. H. Chaplin in the British journal Man.

The boards are most commonly dug into the ground, the predominantly sandy soil making the excavation of holes quite easy. However, wooden boards are also carved.

Rules:

A board is used that consists of four rows, each one with eight holes. A player controls the two rows that are closer to him.

At the start the holes in the outer rows contain two seeds, whereas the inner holes are empty. Each player also has 16 seeds in reserve.

On his turn a player distributes the contents of one of his holes that contains at least two seeds anti-clockwise one by one into the following holes of his side.

If the last seed is dropped into a non-empty hole, its contents (including the last seed) are picked up and then distributed in another lap, unless a capture is conducted.

If the last seed falls into an occupied hole in the inner row and the enemy hole directly opposite is also occupied, the contents of both holes in the opponent's opposite file are captured. These enemy seeds are re-entered in a new lap, the sowing beginning at the hole from which the capture was initiated.

A turn ends when the last seed is placed into an empty hole.

Once in a game a player may distribute his reserve by placing in each of his holes one seed. Then, in the same turn, he continues by making an ordinary move as described.

The game ends when a player cannot move.

The player who could move last wins the game."

39605.name: Nsolo
39605.description:
A mancala game. From http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Nsolo:

Nsolo, also called Nchombwa, is played by the Angoni in Malawi and Zambia. It is the one of the largest mancala games known to exist. A close variant of the game was already described in 1913 by Meredith G. Sanderson, a military doctor in the British colony Nyasaland (today Malawi). The rules which are given in this description were reported in 1975 from Ndola, Zambia. The holes are usually dug in the ground.

Rules:

The game is played on a board ranging from 4 x 8 to 4 x 36 holes.

Each player owns the two rows on his side. If a very large board is used, two teams are fighting against each other.

Initially, there are two stones in each hole except in the rightmost holes (as viewed from the respective owner) of each inner row which are left empty. The largest variant needs 284 stones.

At his turn a player distributes the contents of one of his holes one for one in a counter-clockwise direction in the consecutive holes of his two rows. If the last stone falls in a non-empty hole, its contents (including the last stone) are picked up and then distributed in the same way.

The move ends when the last stone is dropped into an empty hole.

It is only permitted to move singletons for a player if he has no holes left which contain two or more stones. However, singletons may only be moved if the next hole is empty.

If the last stone falls into an empty hole of the players inner row and the opposite hole of the opponents inner row contains stones, these enemy stones are captured.

In addition, this move entitles a player to remove, from any part of his opponent's area, the same number of stones as were captured from the occupied hole.

The captured stones are removed from play.

The game ends when a player resigns or does not have any stones left. When the board position repeats, the game is a draw."

39606.name: Pachgarhwa
39606.description:
Pachgarhwa was first described in 1906 by E. de M. Humphries, a civil servant appointed as the Sub-divisional Officer at Karwi Sub-division at United Provinces, Northern India (today in the Bandi District of Uttar Pradesh).

No cultural background is given except that it "appears to be more popular than its intrinsic interest would seem to merit".

A similar games appears to be Longbeu-a-cha in Assam.



Rules

The board is made of two rows of five holes.

At the beginning, there are in each hole five pieces made of a material called kankar (presumably a mineral used as a construction material, a calcareous laterite with a high lime content).

Each player controls the holes on her side of the board.

At your turn you take all the pieces from any hole on your side of the board and sow them in an anticlockwise sense, one in each hole. After you have sown them, you take the ones in the next hole and keep on sowing with them.

Your turn ends when you put the last piece of a sowing in a hole followed by an empty one.

If the hole following the empty one is not empty, after a player has finished sowing, he captures its contents.

The winner of a game is the one who captures more seeds.

According to the description the game ends when "all the pieces on the board are exhausted"

This is indeed possible, although it is a rather unusual ending. Humphries failed to explain what would happen if a player has no pieces to distribute, while his opponent has still pieces left in his holes.

Similar games (e.g. Bay Khom, Walak-pussa) include the following rule:

The game ends when a player has no legal move and the remaining pieces are captured by his adversary.

The game was played in several rounds, in which holes could be captured, but the exact rules weren't given as "by that time things began to get complicated and I was unable to discover how, if ever, the game ended"."

39607.name: Qelat
39607.description:
A mancala game from Beni Amir & Mensa (the place in Eritrea, not the club). From http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Qelat_(Beni_Amir_%26_Mensa):

"Qelat is a common name for mancala variants played in western Eritrea. In Bilén it is the plural of qeltay, the name of the seeds used in the game. This particular variant is played among the Beni Amir and Mensa people, mainly by elders and young boys in their leisure time, as well as by males generally, especially during the period after marriage ceremonies. The elders often played it for large stakes, such as a hundred cows or a piece of land.

It was first described by Richard Pankhurst in 1971 as Qelat II (Game 11) who stated that "the counting of balls in the course of play is fully permissible."

Rules:

Qelat is played by two players.

The game board consists of two rows of six holes. Initially, there are 4 seeds in each hole.

Qelat is a two-directional game played on a twelve-hole board without pre-designated storehouse holes. As the game proceeds, each player creates up to six storehouse holes, called waldas.

On each turn, players sow only from one of the six holes on their own side of the board, but not from waldas. Seeds from the three holes on a player's right are sown counter-clockwise, whereas seeds from the three holes on a player's left are sown clockwise. Qelat is a single lap mancala game.

The object of the game is to capture holes, which is done, as in many games, by dropping the last ball in any hand into a hole containing three balls which are thus increased to four. Such captured holes, corresponding to the weg of other areas, are known as walda, but can be captured only in certain parts of the board.

The leftmost and rightmost holes on either player's own side of the board, as well as the outer two holes on the opponent's side of the board are eligible to become waldas for that player.

Thereafter seeds accumulate in walda(s) from the sowing of both players. Waldas are not skipped as incorrectly stated by Mohr.

The winner is the player who accumulates the largest number of balls in his walda(s).

Unlike many other mancala games, a player who is unable to move passes turns until a legal move is available. When neither player can move, the game is over. At the end of the game, the player who has captured the most seeds wins.

Pankhurst didn't say how to avoid repetition of board positions. It is suggested to use the following rule from another mancala game (Mazagebh I (Game 12)) of the same region: When a player moves a ball across the end of the board to his opponent's opposite hole the latter player is forbidden to shift the ball back in the following move."

Pankhurst, R. 1971. 'Gabata and Related Board Games of Ethiopia and the Horn of Africa', in Ethiopia Observer; 14 (3): 204.

39608.name: Qelat
39608.description:
A mancala game from Keren. From http://mancala.wikia.com/wiki/Qelat_(Keren)
