39857.name: Beeline
39857.description: Turn over the beehive, and let the marbles fall in a new order each time. Players race to lay out their bee cards in a 'beeline' to match the order of the marbles and buzz the buzzer first.

39858.name: Disney Fairies:  To Know Me Is To Love Me
39858.description: Players choose a card on their turn and read it aloud. It will ask them a question about their personality, with 4 optional answers. Player secretly chooses the answer that best fits them and the other player also guess which answer the player chose. Correct players advance along the game board. First player to reach the end wins.

39859.name: Disney Fairies Fancy Flight
39859.description: Players move along the board based on the spin of the spinner. In the first phase they are searching for the different parts of a special dress-up outfit, using luck of the spin and memory. Once they are all dressed up, they move around the board collecting fairy dust. Player with the most fairy dust collected at the end of the game wins.

39860.name: Back to the Future
39860.description:
A simple roll-and-move game themed around the Back to the Future movie. Produced and made available in the UK by Smiths Crisps, a snack food company.

From the front cover:

"Marty McFly, a senior of Hill Valley School was late for class. After that night, however, when he climbed behind the wheel of a nuclear powered time machine car invented by eccentric scientist Dr. Emmett Brown, he wouldn't be late for anything. In fact, he was 30 years too early.

Marty traveled back in time to 1955 just as the town clock was showing 4 minutes past 10 o'clock in the evening. After hiding the car and cautiously walking through his home town, Marty meets up with Lorraine Baines and George McFly - the two teenagers who are later to become his parents.

Not only had Marty traveled to a point in time before the dawn of rock n' roll and Smiths flavoured crisps but he had tampered with history. He now had a number of problems to solve before he could attempt to get back to his own time.

Now, through this exciting board game, specially produced by Smiths, you can imagine you're Marty and follow his adventures - will you be first to get back to the present time?

Please read the rules of the game carefully before starting our on your journey, you don't want to get stuck in 1955 forever!"

boardgamehonor: 2009 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
39861.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Memoir '44 Campaign Book invites you to relive the conflicts of World War II in all of their staggering scope and intensity. Included are more than 50 new scenarios and advanced campaign rules covering three Theaters of Operations throughout the War: The Battle for Normandy in the summer of 1944, the Blitzkrieg to the West in 1940, and Operation Barbarossa on the Russian Front in 1941.

The new campaign rules let you play scenarios in succession, with the outcome of each battle impacting what follows: each success brings you closer to victory, while defeats will deal you temporary set-backs, or worse, the complete rout of your Army!

With the Memoir '44 Campaign book, you'll step into the boots of Montgomery, or head out at the front of a German column to try and throw the Allies back to the sea. Unleash your Panzers onto hapless Belgium and France, or advance into the frozen steppes of the Soviet empire.

http://www.daysofwonder.com/memoir44/en/content/cb1_inside/

Part of the Memoir '44 series.

The Battle for Normandy can be played without any expansions, but you will need tiles from Memoir '44: Terrain Pack and Memoir '44: Eastern Front for Blitzkrieg to the West and Operation Barbarossa.

One of the twelve campaigns also requires Memoir '44: Air Pack, which is recommended, though not required, for the other campaigns.

Buy the Microbadge
39861.name: Memoir '44: Campaign Book Volume 1
boardgamepodcastepisode: Meeples & Miniatures - Episode #49

39862.description:
Take off to the Great White North where you will use your axe and your wits to get ahead of fellow lumberjacks. You may get a boost from some Flapjacks or be slowed by Blisters – but always be wary of the dreaded Sasquatch!

Flapjacks and Sasquatches is an easy, "take that" style card game in which you want to chop down the tree card in front of you. The card has both a "chop" value and a point value; using Axe cards, you roll dice to try to meet or exceed the "chop" value. When you do, you collect the tree (and the points). Flapjack cards can add to your roll, while blister cards can take away.
39862.name: Flapjacks and Sasquatches
boardgameexpansion: Flapjacks & Sasquatches: Cup of Joe Expansion
Flapjacks & Sasquatches: Mound of Bacon expansion

39863.name: Argonaute
39863.description:
Argonaute is a Naval War Game for 2 players, which recreates the Battle of Trafalgar, where a player commands the British Royal Navy and the other the French Imperial Squad.

The game is the movement of warships through cards of motion, the board that recreates the Cape of Trafalgar, aiming to fight and destroy the enemy fleet, gain control over the Atlantic.

The War Game is Print & Play

39864.name: Im Punktumdrehn
39864.description: Nine colored dots are on a card in the middle of the table. Each player has a number of cards with four colored dots in front of him/her. The goal is to find a dot combination of one of them in the nine dots in the middle. When this is achieved, the successful player turns over the card and places it in the middle - there are nine dots on the backside, so the game continues immediately. Whoever gets rid of his/her cards first, wins the game.

39865.name: Gola Foot Ball Game
39865.description:
The label reads: Gola Foot Ball Game, Manufactured by The Cunningham Foot Ball Game Company, 3406 Clifford Street, Philadelphia, PA., Copywrighted 1901

Four drawings of women in long, Victorian dresses, who are waving flags (one flag for HARVARD and one flag for YALE). One woman in a sailor uniform and one man in a military uniform. Also 8 men playing foot ball and a referee. Old fashioned footballs are around the borders (see photos). Open, it measures 19" wide x 14" high.

Research is being done on this game.

39866.name: Race for the Presidency
39866.description: This hefty game gives players the opportunity to battle to become President of the United States. The board is divided into an inner board, in which electoral votes are collected via luck; and an outer board in which votes are collected via strategic positioning. Players can trade votes, funds, and favors throughout the game as they try to set themselves up to successfully debate issues to collect more votes.

39867.name: Hot Air Ballooning Game
39867.description:
This game was published Albuquerque International Balloon Fiesta. Players race their balloons through a series of obstacles. Each turn they can attempt to change the wind direction and also spin for their movement total. Event cards can give the player and edge or knock them out. Evidently hitting the electrical wires is BAD!

Rather than pawns players move one of the 5 colored balloons which are mounted on 1-foot plastic rods, so that they actually hang above the board. The balloons are meant to be painted so that players can personalize their balloons.

1,000 copies of the game were printed for the Balloon Fiesta. 1983 marked the 200th anniversary of ballooning.

39868.name: Bible Football
39868.description:
This is a trivia game played out on a plastic football field. Each question, if answered correctly, awards a set amount of yardage depending on the question's difficulty. A wooden football is marched up and down the field until a score is made.

Components:
Plastic playing field
Football marker
Number cube (Note: this is not called a die!)
Down marker
Head linesman marker
Scoring crayon
Instructions and question book

The year of publication, 1963 is a guesstimate, as no date appears on the box or in the booklet of rules and questions. Unfortunately even the publisher doesn't know what year this came out! They checked and their finding was it must be "decades ago."

39869.name: Slip Disc
39869.description:
Each player has 15 discs that are secretly placed on opposite sides if the plastic box on spring loaded pins. Players take turns pulling the pins. The discs fall and are either trapped by un-pulled discs or end up on the pulling players side via a ramp. First to get all 15 wins.

The Mattel game is item number 5447 dated 1969

39870.name: Two Hundred Years
39870.description:
5mm Wargame Rules. 1700-1900
These rules are designed for 5mm figures and cover the period approximately 1700 to 1900, which is generally called the Horse and Musket period. The type of game created is definitely of a wargame style as opposed to a board game style. The scales for the game are 1mm = 1m, 1 figure = 20 men and 1 gun = 2 guns. Time scale is less important since the pace of the game will never reflect that of real time. Units are battalion with 15 to 50 figures.

39871.description:
Polish wargame about the operation Overlord.
Game contains four sheets of combat units (around 400) representing regiments, brigades, coastal defense units, points of defense (small delaying forces), tactical and strategical bombers, naval support.
Each hex represents around 2500 meters of actual terrain.
One turn represents one day.
39871.name: Normandia 1944

boardgamehonor: 2009 Årets Spill Best Children's Game Nominee
39872.description:
From the Manufacturer:
It's the same classic game of Guess Who? but with tons of fun extras. This deluxe version of Guess Who has 6 different character themes and 120 new characters to play with. An electric timer, light, and sounds also accompany the fun. All game pieces are contained in the new compact case so kids can bring their gaming fun on the go. Requires two 1.5V AAA or R03 size batteries- not included. Ages 6 and up.
39872.name: Guess Who? Extra

39873.description:
Players select an avatar to represent themselves in the game. The avatars summon troops, equipment, and magic to defeat their enemies. The first player to achieve 7 prestige points wins the game.

The initial release is titled "The Broken Seal" and is sold in core decks and boosters. The core decks contain: a pre-constructed deck of 75 cards, one PK Gold Key, a bonus pack of cards, rules manual, and a game play mat. According to the publisher, the core deck allows for two players to begin playing right away.

The PK Gold Keys found in both the core decks and the booster packs contain a code which can be entered at www.pkcards.com and redeemed for PK Cards prizes.
39873.name: PK Cards: The Broken Seal

39874.name: Atlantix
39874.description:
There's a pyramid made of large wooden blocks of various shapes on the middle of the table.The players disassemble the pyramid and collect its pieces in their own drawers.
In order to do that, players will need good memory and some bluffing.
The first to fill his drawer with the blocks is the winner of the game.

39875.name: Ochsen Soxen
39875.description: Card game with the goal to get most points with you cow cards. You have to place card on the table to win the assessment which where initiated by the players.

39876.name: Boolean Dice
39876.description: Wei-Hwa invented Boolean Dice in early 2004 for the Gathering for Gardner. The components are a set of ten unique dice, with each face either white (with a sticker) or black (without). The game was published with a set of six games and three puzzles, available on the web.

39877.name: Roc, fes-li un petó
39877.description:
A children's card game that was given as a present to the participants in the 12th Festa dels Supers, a big party for the the members of a children's club (more than 1,000,000 members), "Club Super 3", from a TV program in Catalan public TV.

Cards are based on the program's characters.

Rules for two different games are included:


"Parelles super3". It is a memory-like card game, with special cards and actions, like turning over more cards or getting extra turns.



"Que no guanyi el sr. Pla!" It is similar to Old Maid, but with both a good and a bad single cards. The winner is the player who ends the game with the good card, the loser the one with the bad one. Players with no cards are neither losers nor winners. There are extra cards to avoid getting the good card drawn from your hand, or to give back the bad one you just drew.

39878.name: Das Syndikat
39878.description: A "humorous", simple game where players invest in underworld assets (drugs, extortion, vice, girls) and roll for success. Depending on the die roll, various things may happen- get henchmen, steal from other player etc. The player who controls one trade completely wins, or the player owing most of the city squares when the city has been taken completely.

39879.description:
Tosti! is a simple game (created by a child for children) about building sandwiches, specifically tostis, a Dutch version of a grilled cheese.

Players share a deck of translucent cards showing bread, cheese, ham, onions, and tomatoes. On their turn, players will draw a card to start a new sandwich, place it on an existing sandwich, or put it on the bottom of the deck.

Complete the required number of sandwiches to win the game!
39879.name: Tosti!

39880.name: Digid
39880.description:
Digid is a two-player abstract board game. There is an edition with black and white stones and one with red and blue stones. If you have them both, you can play the game with 4 players.

Pieces have a value of 0 to 9 and players take turns moving a piece similar to the move of the king in chess. Opposing pieces can be taken only by a piece of higher value, with an exception for the 9 piece.

Play continues until a player cannot make a move. At that time the player with the most points still on the board wins.

boardgamehonor: 2004 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
2004 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Kinder Recommended
39882.description:
Each child takes the role of the little elephant Willi trying to blow the dandelions around the meadow. Who would like to help Willi to collect as many dandelions as possible in order to let them dance in the wind?

You have to collect the most flowers from the board. Each player gets a card which shows the color they have to collect.

On the board flower cards are put randomly. A player at his turn may blow a small ball over the board. When the player gets it between four flowertiles he may take all the flower tiles in his color. When the ball ends on a flower he can take one of his flowers from anywhere on the board.

The player that collects all his flowers first wins the game.
39882.name: Pusteblume

39883.name: Hullunkuriset ehdokkaat
39883.description:
Hullunkuriset ehdokkaat is satirical card game about Finlands presidential election in 1982. Art of the cards is made by most famous Finnish political cartoonist Kari.

Game play is based on card game Hullunkuriset perheet, which is just Finnish version of The Game of Authors. The name Hullunkuriset ehdokkaat means funny candidates. There is only 24 cards (four suits of five cards and four extra cards). These suits represent main parties and their candidates. The extra cards are other known political figures of the time.

Game play is very simple. You just draw a card from the next player and she/he does the same and so on. The winner is the player who gets all cards of one suit and he/she has to shout "Pressa!", which means that she/he has elected new president of Finland.

Re-implements:

The Game of Authors

39884.name: There's Only One Winner!
39884.description: This is designated as a "fun game" by the designer, in contrast to his simulation-type, statistics-based sports games. Players run one horse race or, recommended, a series of races on a simple track. Various race events can be run on the same course. Players secretly bet on the horses and are allowed to do so until the horses are close to the line, but odds decrease with a horse's progress. Horse movement is rolled for, with two horses moved per turn, but players have bonus movement cards to influence the result.

39885.name: Rise of Eagles 1805; Battle Scenario for Shako II
39885.description:
First scenario book for the Shako II rule system, although also usable with other games.
Depicts the battles of the 1805 campaign:
Wertingen
Gunzburg
Haslach-Jungingen
Elchingen
Albeck
Caldiero
Amstetten
Mariazell
Durrenstein
Schongrabern
Raussnitz
Austerlitz
Stecken

Both Caldiero and Austerlitz appear as either part-of-the-battle or (huge) complete battle

39886.name: IceFrogs
39886.description:
IceFrogs is an abstract strategy game for 2-3 players. Players jump their pyramids across the board in an attempt to get a piece into their opponent's start space. Two Icehouse stashes and 37 poker chips (or other round discs) are required.

Game System

Icehouse Pieces

39887.description:
Bee Victorious! is a self-designed, self-published game by Lidna W. Purdy.

A new queen bee has invaded the hive.

In this game, each player has a set of 13 bees in three different kinds. One Queen Bee, 6 Worker Bees and 6 Drones. Each army is set up on opposite sides of the hive. The object of the game is to capture the opponent's queen. A bee is captured (removed form the board) when an opposing bee lands on the same spot.

The Hive (gameboard) is a large hex grid with each hex containing arrows which show the only directions a bee may travel from one hex to another. There are also four exits from the hive, which allow bees to fly around the hive and enter it in a different area.

The game is also won if you force the opposing queen to exit the hive via one of the exits.
39887.name: Bee Victorious!

39888.description:
Play the popular OOTS board game in just two hours with The Shortening expansion. With new monsters, new shticks, new backstories, and a certain lich who isn't going to just sit around and wait for you to get to the bottom of the dungeon, you'll have more fun in half the time.

Based on the popular web-comic, Order of the Stick.

Expands:

Order of the Stick Adventure Game: The Dungeon of Dorukan
39888.name: Order of the Stick Adventure Game: The Shortening
boardgameexpansion: Order of the Stick Adventure Game: The Dungeon of Dorukan

39889.description:
This is the second issue of "Tactiques, Le magazine des fanatiques d'ASL". It includes 10 ASL scenarios and several articles about ASL. It is no longer in print, its successor is the magazine "Le franc tireur".

Publication date: June 1992.

Contains 47 pages devoted exclusively to ASL. Index of contents for this issue:

-Dossier: La Division Azul et la neutralite espagnole
-Front de l'est
-Tactiques
-Aides de jeu
-10 ASL Scenarios:

ASL TAC11: Une danse avec la Reine
ASL TAC12: Commando Schenke
ASL TAC13: La neige et le sang
ASL TAC14: Entre le marteau et l'enclume II
ASL TAC15: La vallee du tonnerre
ASL TAC16: Nettoyage d'ete
ASL TAC17: Bren-guns
ASL TAC18: May Day
ASL TAC19: Champs de Noël
ASL TAC20: Triste bapteme
39889.name: Tactiques Issue #2

39890.description:
This is the third issue of "Tactiques, Le magazine des fanatiques d'ASL". It includes 10 ASL scenarios and several articles about ASL. It is no longer in print, its successor is the magazine "Le franc tireur".

Publication date: December 1992.

Contains 47 pages devoted exclusively to ASL. Index of contents for this issue:

-Dossier: Les Merrill's Marauders en Birmanie
-Tactiques
-Regles optionnelles
-Aides de jeu
-10 ASL Scenarios:

ASL TAC21: L'infanterie attaque
ASL TAC22: Ils tiraient sur Odessa...
ASL TAC23: Bain de minuit a Tobrouk
ASL TAC24: Un coin d'enfer
ASL TAC25: Nella Nebbia
ASL TAC26: Orange a Walawbum
ASL TAC27: Jusqu'au bout de leurs forces
ASL TAC28: Il etait une petite colonne...
ASL TAC29: La crete de Kakazu
ASL TAC30: Yae Dake
39890.name: Tactiques Issue #3

39891.description:
This is the fourth issue of "Tactiques, Le magazine des fanatiques d'ASL". It includes 8 ASL scenarios and several articles about ASL. It is no longer in print, its successor is the magazine "Le franc tireur".

Publication date: June 1993.

Contains 47 pages devoted exclusively to ASL. Index of contents for this issue:

-Dossier: Les tirailleurs senegalais dans l'armee francaise en 1940
-Documents: Bir Hakeim
-Tactiques
-8 ASL Scenarios:

ASL TAC31: Par Saint Georges1
ASL TAC32: Contre-attaque a Connage
ASL TAC33: Carre d'as
ASL TAC34: Thulin doit etre pris!
ASL TAC35: Envers et contre tous
ASL TAC36: La mort vient du ciel
ASL TAC37: Chaud! Chaud les buron!
ASL TAC38: Whoa Mohammed!
39891.name: Tactiques Issue #4

39892.description:
This is the fifth issue of "Tactiques, Le magazine des fanatiques d'ASL". It includes 4 ASL scenarios, a campaign game about the Kursk battle and several articles about ASL. It is no longer in print, its successor is the magazine "Le franc tireur".

Publication date: December 1993.

Contains 47 pages devoted exclusively to ASL. Index of contents for this issue:

-Dossier: La bataille de Koursk et l'Armee rouge
-Tactique
-4 ASL Scenarios:

ASL TAC39: Operation sur la Gudbrandsdal
ASL TAC40: Cauchemar ecossais
ASL TAC41: Dernier arret avant la victoire
ASL TAC42: Une guerre de caporaux
Campagne ASL TAC1: Stalnie prostori
39892.name: Tactiques Issue #5

39893.name: Trilbert
39893.description: Players take alternate turns placing double-colored H-shaped jigsaw tiles. The winner is the first one to form a loop with his color.

39894.name: Mediterranean Salvo!
39894.description:
Mediterranean Salvo! is a game module that may be used on its own, or in conjunction with any previously published modules of the Salvo! system. Mediterranean Salvo! contains the basic rules of the Salvo! system (in the form of the postcard game which includes ten ships), a sheet of 42 ships from WWII Mediterranean fleets, and a rule sheet containing optional rules and ship roster.

Expands:


Salvo!
Advanced Salvo! 1939-1941

39895.name: Radio From Hell: Home Edition
39895.description:
From the back of the box: For years, you've enjoyed the "antics" of Radio From Hell" on your radio sets. There have been countless hours of family fun as everyone gathered together around the radio for breakfast and Kerry, Bill and Gina from 6AM to 10AM every morning. The only bad part was having to say "Crap-ola, we're out of orange juice." And "Oh why does the show have to end at 10AM. I wish we could have Radio From Hell with us all day and at night too." Well, now you can with the Radio From Hell Home Edition. We've boxed up all the excitement of a broadcast and turned it into a fast-paced boardgame. That's what you're holding in your hand right now. So quit staring at it, get your wallet and buy one for yourself and give one as a gift. Then take it home and play. The Radio From Hell Home Edition: a great way to waste time when you should be doing something else.

ENJOY!!!!!"

Based on one of the most critically-acclaimed morning shows in the country, Radio From Hell: Home Edition lets you take the role of any of the four members of the show and compete to see who has the most listeners after a week of broadcasting. Cards let you take listeners from other hosts, help segments get closer to being completed for points, or for whatever special ability is on the card.

39896.name: Pawns Crossing
39896.description:
Pawns Crossing is an abstract game that combines a requirement for tactical skill with a modest luck element. Players race to move tokens to their destinations over a tile and domino board. The game incorporates three separate movement mechanics which players must choose between at the beginning of each turn: a) Tokens move along the surfaces of dominoes and tiles, b) pawns move between holes that exist in the board at domino intersections, c) The rows and columns of the board shift. A complete game typically takes 20-40 minutes. The game may be enjoyed by two to four players but a 2-player game feels different from a 4-player game. As with many multi-player abstracts, the 2-player version is more strategic.

Requires a piecepack and a set of double six dominoes.

39897.name: PackKub
39897.description:
This game is a loose adaptation of the game Rummikub to the piecepack.

The goal of each round is to empty your hand by making melds to the table. On each player’s turn, the player must either make one or more melds to the table or draw a tile from the draw pile and add it to his hand. When one player has emptied his hand (by making melds), the round is over and is scored.

39898.name: Word Pirates!
39898.description: Build bridges, acquire land and block your way to the pirates’ treasure, matey! Players roll letter dice to build bridges of words and use rock walls to block their enemies’ paths all in an effort to make their way across shark infested waters in order to be the first one to reach the pirate loot.

39899.name: Baryon
39899.description:
An abstract game that uses color as an element. Each player have 3 pieces, one in each color, red green and blue. If you move a blue piece into a blue square you capture all your opponents pieces that are also on a blue square. You also get an extra turn.

You score one point for each piece you capture and win by getting five points.

39900.name: Monkey Mayhem
39900.description:
From the publisher's site:
It's night time at the zoo. All the visitors have come and gone, and the zookeepers have headed home. Amongst the packing crates scattered around their enclosure, the monkeys gather for their regular competition!

Each Sunday night, the monkeys race to push the crates together to build a tall tower. Choose your monkey and by matching food tokens to the colors on the packing crates, climb to the top first. Watch out for the other monkeys who may try and scare you away or block your moves. Make the most of each monkey’s special abilities to help you climb higher. The first one to clamber high enough to leap into a nearby tree, spends a night on the town!

The others stay behind to cover the escapee's tracks and await the monkey's return, planning to be the fastest one next time they compete. Plan your moves carefully and you’ll be the one creating mayhem!

39901.description:
There is a lot of hubbub among the mice as there are only a few minutes left before the annual relay race begins. The mice warm themselves up, as each team wants to win the race. The cheese has to be quickly lifted and placed on the head, the tidbits added and they are off...

As soon as the first mouse of a team stands completely on the opposite mouse hole,the game ens, thereby winning the game.
39901.name: Mauseloch

39902.name: The Water Game
39902.description: A game produced by the Public Information Unit of North West Water, a water supply company serving north west England. It was designed to teach children about the water cycle and the role of the water authorities.

39903.name: Multzo
39903.description: Multzo, a game for 2-5 players, uses the 24 tiles and 24 coins from a piecepack. (The four dice and four pawns are not used.) It is in the family of Poker and other vying card games. But it doesn't require cash to be interesting. Players try to gain groups of tiles with the highest value, and there are four different ways to determine the best group (and up to four winners!) each round.

39904.name: New City
39904.description:
Hear ye! Hear ye! With the growing expansion of the King’s realm, the time has come to build a new city on the edge of his empire. Aptly named ‘New City’ by our wise and glorious King, he has sent his four best advisers to oversee its construction, each responsible for building one quarter of it.

As one of those advisers, your job is to bid against your opponents to ensure you build the best and brightest area of the city. Whichever adviser has built the most prosperous quarter, as shown by the amount of gold in his coffers, will be declared the ruler of this ‘New City’.

39905.name: Goin' Nuts
39905.description:
This game looks like a tree, standing about 12" tall. The goal is to get all of your squirrel's color marbles in your area.

The base of the tree has four player areas. Each player's area has a squirrel in one of four colors and four knot holes. Players put colored marbles into the knot holes and use the squirrels to launch the balls into the canopy of the tree. Baffles in the tree trunk bounce the balls around and they roll out of random holes in the base of the tree into the players areas. The first player to get all of their colored marbles wins.

39906.description:
During the Second World War, Italian tank units matched brave crews with decrepit vehicles. Thanks to the monopolies held by the fascist state's favorite corporations, badly outdated tanks caused the deaths of hundreds of tank crewmen trying to combat much more capable Allied tanks with their Italian "iron coffins."

Better machines could have been made available: the P26/40 "heavy" tank (actually a medium-sized vehicle) that failed to enter production in time for the campaign in North Africa, or the German licenses that Italy never sought.

Divisione Corazzata is a supplement based on Italy's planned but un-built vehicles, drawing on pieces already provided in our Desert Rats game and Gold Club supplementary counter sheet, but until now never used in scenarios.

There are ten scenarios, or separate game situations, exploring the potential use of these vehicles. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of our Eastern Front, Battle of the Bulge, Afrika Korps and Desert Rats games. It also requires the 2007 Gold Club Coutnersheet or the downloaded counters from Avalanche Press.

Divisione Corazzata is sold exclusively via PDF download. The scenario book comes as a PDF file that you'll need to print (or read off the screen) in order to play the scenarios.
39906.name: Panzer Grenadier: Divisione Corazzata
boardgameexpansion: Panzer Grenadier: Battle of the Bulge

39907.name: Coalition
39907.description:
Coalition is a card game for 2 to 4 players, which simulates the Napoleonic Wars, where each manages the armies of France, England, Prussia and Russia

The game consists in the administration of cards that represent military units of each of these armies, in addition have special cards strategic, to the conquest of territories in Europe of the XIX century.

Every new battle areas and cards are incorporated, and expand the strategic power for the battle ahead.

The Card Game is Print & Play

39908.name: Alexander at Waterloo
boardgameexpansion: La Bataille de Mont Saint Jean
39908.description: A fantasy scenario for "La Bataille de Mont St. Jean" that confronts the troops of the Duke of Wellington against the Macedonian Army of Alexander the Great.

39909.name: Torres Quiz Master
39909.description:
Torres Quiz Master is a game in which participants can demonstrate and increase their knowledge about the world of wines. To do this, they must answer questions and challenges fellow players will pose to them.

Bodegas Torres is one of the most important wineries of Spain and the game is only available like a present from them.

39910.name: Vandaria Wars
39910.description:
The First TCG/CCG made in Indonesia, have something in common with Magic and Legend of Five Rings.

In Indonesian Language

In This game you play as a landlord in the Vandaria world, you compete with each other to rule the world.
Players can build Forts and Territories, hire armies (Followers), use technology devices (Relic), or use magical powers (Rune).

Races : Human, there are 4 Factions (Order, Chaos, Prosper, Noble).
Frameless, there are 1 primary Faction (Mystic) and 2 supporting Factions (Eden & Reigner).

Official Web
http://www.gamequarters.net/vandaria/?page_id=272
Wiki Entry
http://id.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vandaria_Wars

39911.name: Our Gang Tipple Topple Game
39911.description: By ALL FAIR GAMES of Churchville, NEW YORK. This game based on the "Our Gang" series which was produced by HAL ROACH STUDIOS Inc. is a simple game with the object being to roll balls at targets who represent some of the stars of the show; Spanky, Darla, Buckwheat, Farina, Chubby, Jackie and Pete the Wonderdog. Hitting the targets scored differing amounts of points.

39912.name: Harry Potter Quidditch
39912.description: Harry Potter - Quiddtich is easy memory game. Your task is to find 4 parts of a Quiddtich stadium and then to find the tile with the ball to score. Just be careful, if you find all parts of the stadium but do not find the ball your opponent can place a tile with the minus scoring and give you some minus points this way.

39913.name: Paired Up: Fame & Fortune
39913.description:
The Fame & Fortune card set expands Paired Up with more cards. On each card, one pair is shown in red as a "fame and fortune" pair, such as a famous celebrity couple.

Expands:

Paired Up

39914.name: Zombiegeddon
39914.description:
Well, it was nice while it lasted! You have gotten word that the end is near, and Armageddon is right around the corner. (Actually, it begins tonight!) Since it may be a while before you can get to the store, today would be a good time to gather as many supplies as possible. After all, tomorrow might be the beginning of a long, cold, (nuclear) winter!

Reiner Knizia’s Zombiegeddon is a fast-paced, perfect-information, strategy game. Each player spends the first half of the game rushing around the board collecting supplies and weapons, fighting off the occasional looter and trying to stop your pesky neighbors from taking stuff that is rightfully yours. (At least as far as you are concerned!)

The second half of the game is spent trying to survive. Sure there is some good stuff around, but it certainly isn’t plentiful and zombies are out in force, offering big points for those with the weapons to fight through, and dead ends to those who can't. Whoever has the most stuff at the end of the game wins.

This game is based on the same prototype as Jäger und Sammler.

39917.description: Players are school teachers attempting to stop Rocky and his friends from skipping school. They draw cards with students or force a player to discard one of their student cards. The first player fill all eight spots in their school house rings the bell and wins the game.
39917.name: Rocky and his Friends Game
boardgamefamily: TV Series: The Rocky and Bullwinkle Show

39918.name: Wonderbug Game
39918.description: Players are building the ultimate Wonderbug who is the cartoon character Schlep. Players must get the parts needed for his redesign and get them back to the repair shop in order to take the magic horn and win the game.

39919.name: Sullivan's Mountain
39919.description: Players are explorers, climbing Sullivan's Mountain, seeking the treasure hidden at the topmost cave. As players collect the necessary items of kit to advance to the next level, they will have to avoid spiders, snakes, and other mountain beasties.

39920.name: L'esprit de Marie Antoinette
39920.description:
Each player assigns Scents from his hand between the various Preparations of his parfumothèque. At the end of the game and taking into account the Trends that are marked by the Parisian Nobility, the Preparations are presented to Marie Antoinette. The player who gets more points wins; one of his Preparations would become "The spirit of Marie Antoinette" and that player will become part of the court as royal perfumer!.


L'esprit de Marie Antoinette Project wiki (in Spanish)



Playtestings & Design Notes (in Spanish)



A redesign of @EvePizzagalli (in Spanish/English/French)



Portfolio @EvePizzagalli


This game is one of the 10 finalists of the 2009 Concurs Ciutat de Granollers de creació de jocs.

The game is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike licence.

39921.name: Rockin' Robots
39921.description:
From the front of the box:

Look out! Here come the robots - a troupe twenty strong! - on the way back to their spaceship after making many friends on earth. But now it's time for them to go home. Can you help them board their spaceship? It's very unsteady when it's parked on earth, and when they step onto it, they really rock the boat. It's so tippy that when one steps on, two others may fall off.

Find 1 - 4 friends and take turns balancing the rocky robots on their spaceship. Make a game of it - last one to add a robot without tipping any robots off wins the game!

The robots are lots of fun to play with here on earth, too. You can stack them into interesting towers, and imagine all sorts of adventures for them.

Set includes:
20 wooden Robots, 4 each of 5 colors
1 robot Spaceship
1 large, colorful Die

Ages 3 and up

39922.name: Mrs. Casey Wants to Know
39922.description:
There are two sets of cards, one with a question and one with an answer. One player picks up a question card and reads it to the player on their left. The player on the left picks up an answer card and reads it out loud. All the other players, including the questioner, burst into laughter trying to make the player reading the answer to laugh. If that player does not laugh or smile, the questioner takes another question card and reads it to the same person repeating the same answer as to the first question. If the player answering the questioner succeeds in keeping a straight face on four cards (giving the same answer for each card) that player keeps their answer card. The same questioner then asks the second player on their left another four questions, etc.

As soon as a player laughs or smiles while being questioned, they forfeit their card and now they take up a question card and become the questioner. The game continues until all of the answer slips are gone.

The winner is the player having the greatest number of answer slips in front of them.

39923.name: Brazilwood
39923.description:
Brazilwood is a board game where you are a rich colonizer, which receives a large colony in Brazil to extract Brazilwood, so you have to enslave Indians, build their colony and negotiate with other settlers, the best selling prices of Brazilwood .

The game consists in obtaining resources (Brazilwood) and its marketing with the Portuguese Crown, this occurs with the administration of cards (Farmhouse, Slave House, Born, Militia, Farm, Forest and Slaves) with the objective of selling their produce to the Portuguese Crown.

But the strategy is crucial, because it must manage its finances, choose the time and quantity of Brazilwood right to sell to get the best prices.

The Game is Print & Play

39924.name: C'est qui qu'a pété ?!
39924.description:
Material:

10 Location Cards
40 Fart Card (in 5 colors)

The goal of the game is to accumulate less "Shame" possible by trying to pass onto others the farts that you make.

The game lasts 8 rounds and each player gets 8 cards. The active player turns a location card and then each player plays a fart card face down. In clockwise order, players acknowledge that they farted or not. If they do they get the location card with the side with less "shame". If everyone does not, then they reveal their cards and the highest number get the card (full "shame" side).

Every player get in his 8 cards a complicity card. If played along with another player's complicity, then they both are 0. If played alone, it's the highest number.

39925.name: Decisions! Decisions!
39925.description:
Decisions! Decisions!

"The ultimate investment challenge game."

(c)1997 DMC Enterprises

"You've just graduated from high school and one of the most important decisions of your life awaits you..."

Players choose to attend college or enter the business world. Players move around the board as they acquire property or earn a college degree. Players may drop out of school and try to get rich in the world of high finance.

Includes board, tokens, play money, event cards, stock certificates, rules, and a storage insert.

www.decisionsdecisions.com

boardgamehonor: 2009 Jogo do Ano Nominee
2010 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee
2010 JoTa Best Heavy Board Game Nominee
39927.description:
Last Train to Wensleydale is a railway themed game set in the Yorkshire Dales. The aim of the game is to move stone, cheese, and passengers from the Dales to the major trunk routes served by the North Eastern Railway and the Midland Railway.

Valleys play a large part in dictating where you can build track. Once you have built a line you must acquire second hand engines and rolling stock to move the goods and passengers that your line connects to. Such a line quickly becomes unprofitable and it pays to have one of the two major companies take it over from you.

Building track can also be made more difficult by local residents who object to railways being built on their land. To overcome such opposition you require influence in government to arrange the necessary compulsory purchase orders.

Description of the game, from the backside of the box:
For many years the train gaming world has been waiting for a game about moving cheese in the Yorkshire Dales. That wait is now over!
As the director of a small railway company who has inveigled investment money from gullible locals, it's up to you to see if you can actually make a profit from building track amongst some of the most difficult terrain in England. There's stone to be moved from quarries, and cheese to be moved to market. You might also find the odd passenger who wants to travel to civilization.

However, standing in your way is the local farmer, who really does not want you to build on his land. Fortunately you can buy favours from the necessary government committee to deal with such irritations. You will also need a few contacts with other train companies, as you will need their second-hand engines to run on your lines. Finally, once you've sucked all the profit that you can from a route, you must off-load it to a major train company before you are saddled with the losses.
39927.name: Last Train to Wensleydale

39928.name: Intimate Commands
39928.description:
A roll and move game (move around the outside of the board style), where players are asked to do things like 'Remove One Piece of Apparel', and 'Take A Drink'. The object of the game (well, aside from trying to "get it on") is to collect ten 'Dream' cards by moving around the board ten times.

This is a mature audiences game for couples, with many of the cards referring to (and telling the players to perform) sex acts.

39929.name: Eighty Years War
39929.description:
from the Warp Spawn Site:

Simulation of the Dutch (Netherlands) Revolt 1568-1648.

This is a card game for two players.

VICTORY
The game ends after 15 turns.
If the Dutch have 7 Provinces, and the Spanish have 10 Provinces, it is a Historical Tie.
If the Dutch player has 8+ Provinces it is a Dutch Victory.
If the Spanish Player has 11+ Provinces it is a Spanish Victory.

PROVINCE TOKENS
Use 17 Tokens to represent the 17 Provinces.

STAGES
The game has 3 stages:
Stage I (early) Stage II (Middle) Stage III (Late)
Each stage has 5 Turns.
Certain cards can only be played in specific Stages.

39930.name: Kromino
39930.description:
Kromino is a game in which players use 45 uniquely colored square tiles to create geometrical patterns within a 5x9 frame. Players are given a supply of tiles for use in completing patterns such as diamonds, windmills, and arrowheads. Points are assigned based on the color(s) of the tiles.

The game is a nice quality wooden game. The tiles themselves are laminated wood. The 10.5" x 17.5" redwood frame is unusual in that it has a removable plexiglass cover. Completely assembled it looks like a piece of abstract art.

39931.name: Rombo
39931.description:
From the designer's website:

Rombo is a boardless strategy game in which players add pieces to a steadily growing cluster in an effort to cut off enemy areas.

Rules

Two players, White and Black, each have 24 pieces of their colour called rombos. Each rombo has twelve identical faces.

Start: The game starts with two White and two Black rombos joined together in a cluster.

Play: Each turn the current player must add a rombo of their colour to the cluster. The new rombo must exactly meet at least two faces of existing rombos. It is not allowed to form closed holes which would make the cluster hollow.

Aim: A player wins by splitting the visible enemy faces into two or more disjoint sets. If neither player achieves this before the pieces run out then the game is a draw.

39932.description:
(from GMT website:)

The Great Battles of History series ventures back into the mists of time: the Bronze Age, or the Age of the Chariot. From approximately 1700 BC to 1200 BC (which was the abrupt end of the Bronze Age) the chariot reigned supreme on the battlefield. It was the first modern weapons system, and chariots controlled most of warfare until actual cavalry appeared in the middle of the Iron Age.

But how did chariots work as a tactical weapons system? There is no complete historical agreement on what exactly they did or how they were used, but Chariots of Fire will show you our view of their many applications - and many types of chariotry there were - providing GBoH players with the complete and definitive chariot rules. These rules cover combat and mobility from the first battle wagons of the Sumerians to the two-man, fast-moving light chariots of the Egyptians, often complete with their associated and specialized Runner Infantry, to the heavy 3-man Hittite wheels.
To simulate these ancient tactical details Chariots of Fire presents you with nine battles:
Sumer (ca 2320 BC) - featuring the legendary Sargon the Great
Sekhmen (1875 BC)
Megiddo (ca 1479 BC)
Senzar (1470)
The Astarpa (1312 BC)
Kadesh (1300 BC)
Nihriya (1230 BC)
Babylon (1225 BC)
and Troy (1200 BC) - including an extra: Homer's heros!

And of armies Chariots of Fire has plenty, and a truly colorful bunch they are: Sumerians, Akkadians, all sorts of Egyptians, Canaanites, Hittites, Mitanni, Arzawans, Assyrians, Babylonians, and the Myceaen Age Greeks.

Game Features
TIME SCALE 20 minutes per turn
MAP SCALE 100 yards per hex
UNIT SCALE 350 men per mounted unit
PLAYING TIME 1-3 hours


(from BGG description:)

Historical Note: The period following The Bronze Age, from what is known as The Catastrophe of ca. 1200 BC to the rise of the Greek city-states, is almost totally devoid of any sort of information, and that includes archaeological remains. It is the true Dark Age of history. When the area emerged from that era, warfare had undergone major changes and chariots had been relegated to the sidelines.

Three errata counters for Chariots of Fire were included in C3i #24.
39932.name: Chariots of Fire

39933.name: Ride the Dragon
39933.description: This is a novelty game about riding a motorcycle through "The Dragon", that is US 129 through Deal's Gap in Tennessee. It has novelty motorcycle figures and is a basic roll and move game.

39934.name: Critèrium de Figueres
39934.description:
A cycling criterium is a short bicycle race often run on closed-off city centre streets. Criteriums are traditionally associated with village fairs, when a bike race is another attraction. In Critèrium de Figueres the players race to be the first to complete one lap around the worldwide famous Rambla de Figueres. The fastest rider will be he who gets more help from the other players, but of course he will have been helping them in exchange.

This game was originally produced for the "Pedalant Pel Tauler" cycling board games exhibition held at the Museu del Joguet de Catalunya (Figueres) in October 2007.

39936.name: Back in the Bronx
39936.description:
Back in the Bronx

"Celebrating the experience of growing up and living in the Bronx."

This is a combination board game and dexterity game.

Players move around a colorful board featuring famous landmarks from this New York municipality including Yankee Stadium, Orchard Beach, and Van Cortland Park.

Contestants also pitch pennies and play jacks!

Includes the board, 4 pewter tokens, cards, jacks, pennies, marbles, a rubber ball, bottle caps, chips, dice, storage insert, and rules.

www.backinthebronx.com

39937.name: Redemption
39937.description:
Redemption is a satirical look at the Catholic Church. Players take turns traveling the paths of Grace or Sin while gaining chips for Mortal Sins and Grace points. Sin Cards and Grace Cards randomly chosen can either help or hinder you.

The game includes pieces for up to 4 players.
1 gameboard
20 red Sin Cards
20 yellow Grace Cards
80 pieces of play money
420 red and yellow grace chips
A rather humorous back story and designer notes.

boardgamehonor: 2010 Golden Geek Best Strategy Board Game Nominee
39938.description:
Carson City is a strategic game played in four rounds, and in each one of them, the players choose a character from the seven available that gives certain advantages.

After selecting characters, your cowboys are placed on action track locations that allow you to construct buildings, houses, or roads; claim ground; earn money; or score victory points. When more than one player is on the same location, get ready, it is time for a duel! Roll the dice and see if you are the last one standing and lay claim to the goods!

During the game, you can take various actions that earn you victory points for your plots, pistols (the hired help), and buildings. At the end of the game, your buildings, houses, mountains, and money contribute to your victory points, and the person with the most points wins. So go round up your posse of gunslingers and get ready for some Wild West action in Carson City!
boardgameversion: Quined White Goblin Master Print Second Edition
39938.name: Carson City
boardgameexpansion: Carson City: The Teacher & Town Hall
boardgameaccessory: Carson City: Metal Coins and Turn Marker
boardgamepodcastepisode: 8 Player Risk: A Cautionary Tale.  Episode 25
BGA Episode 100 - Top 100 Games of All Time
D6G Ep 78: Adepticon 2011 & Carson City Detailed Review
Episode 1: Carson City and Our Thoughts of RPGs
Episode 2 - Picking Over the Bones
Episode 23: Tail Feathers Review - Jamey Stegmaier Interview
Episode 28: Bootleggers, Honorary Founder Stephen Buonocore and Board Game Components
Episode 37 – Carson City
Episode 72- The Castles of Burgundy and Aunt Peggy 2
Ep_006 – The Crew is Forced to Choose 5 Board Games
MOBG Bonus episode. Kickstarter Carson City
The Good The Board and The FIGHT!: Episode 65 “Combat”
The Good, The Board, and the ……………..:Episode 23 “Analysis Paralysis”
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 93!!

boardgamehonor: 2012 Charles S. Roberts Best Ancient to Napoleonic Era Board Wargame Nominee
2012 Charles S. Roberts Best Ancient to Napoleonic Era Board Wargame Winner
2012 Charles S. Roberts Best Board Game Graphics Nominee
2012 Charles S. Roberts Best Board Game Graphics Winner
39939.description:
From the Clash of Arms May 2008 Works In Progress flyer:

Fontenoy brings the highly successful Battles from the Age of Reason series to the War of Austrian Succession, with several nationalities not yet seen in the series: French, Dutch, Hanoverians and English on the Continent. Fontenoy is a tight test between the greatest captain of the war - Maurice de Saxe, commanding French forces behind defensive works against the inexperienced Duke of Cumberland commanding a mixed group of Allied troops. Aside from the classic, historical battle in which the Allies try to breach the French defenses, variants will allow players to explore options which allow the Allies to outflank the French, add more forces to both sides, and even take away the French defenses for a straight-up contest on the plains of Flanders. Fontenoy retains all of the aspects of the previous games of the series set in the Seven Years War. The scale is 100 yards per hex and 20 minute game turns, with infantry battalions, cavalry regiments, and artillery batteries at the scale of 1 strength point equals 100 foot soldiers, 50 horsemen, or 2 cannon.

Also included is the Battle of Melle, 9 July, 1745. This is a complete battle with a small number of counters per side, played out on a half size map. Melle is a rare meeting engagement and is a swirling, chaotic battle as each side seeks to obtain their objectives before night falls. Melle is a quick game, ideal for BAR beginners or for those who want to play out a full battle in one sitting.

Components:
-3rd Edition Standard Series Rules booklet
-Exclusive Rules booklet containing Special Rules, Scenarios, and Historical Commentary
-Two 22"x34" and one 22"x17" color period style maps
-Two 11"x17" army organizational displays
-560 full color Combat, Leader, & Game Counters, plus 280 black & white markers
-Charts, Tables, and card stock Combat Resolution Cards
-Two ten sided dice
39939.name: The Battle of Fontenoy: 11 May, 1745
boardgamefamily: Battles from the Age of Reason (BAR)

39940.description:
(from Clash of Arms website and flyer:)

Prague - The Empty Triumph is the eighth volume in the Battles from the Age of Reason game series and continues the course of the Seven Years War in central Europe.

On May 6, 1757 King Frederick II of Prussia sent 65,000 men on a maneuver to turn the right flank of 62,000 Austrians strongly deployed along a ridge east of the city Prague under the command of Prince Charles of Lorraine. Both sides were poised for a battle which would be the largest of the war.

Although the battle clearly was a Prussian success the victory fell short because Prague succesfully withstood the enemy siege until June 16 when Marshal Daun's Austrian relief force dealt Frederick his first defeat on the rolling hills near Kolin.

The map and time scale: 100 yards per hex and 20 minute game turns. Units represent battalions, regiments, squadrons, companies and batteries or sections of artillery (1 strength point equals 100 men, 50 horsemen or 2 cannon).
The counters represent the various arms, individual leaders and game markers needed to play the game.

Prague allows players to explore all aspects of this critical and bloody battle with one and two-map scenarios or replay the entire action using all three maps.

As a bonus this game includes the Lobositz Expansion map.

Components:

3rd Edition Standard Series Rules booklet;
Exclusive Rules booklet containing Special Rules, Scenarios and Historical Commentary;
Three 22" x 34" full color, period-style maps;
420 1/2" Counters, both full color and black & white;
Cardstock charts & tables;
Two 10-sided dice.
39940.name: Prague: The Empty Triumph
boardgamefamily: Battles from the Age of Reason (BAR)

39941.description:
From Clash of Arms May 2008 Works in Progress flyer:
Description:
Legion of Honor is a highly innovative game that recreates the personal drama of the Napoleonic wars. Using a quick-playing, card-driven game system, each player assumes the role of a French soldier -- or grognard -- starting out as a young sergeant or sous-lieutenant trying to make it in life beginning in 1792. Fortunately for the enterprising grognard, he can look forward to over twenty years of almost continuous war provided courtesy of the Directory and Napoléon!

Game play is broken down into a series of campaign seasons that span the period from the Brunswick Manifesto in 1792 to The Hundred Days of 1815. Each campaign season consists of a number of 'In Garrison' rounds and 'On Campaign' rounds. During these rounds, major historical events take place, from the arrest and execution of Louis XVI to the coronation of Napoléon, from great battles to the "whiff of grapeshot." History is fixed, with events happening like they actually did, that is, with one exception: will the English christen that climactic battle of 1815 The Battle of Waterloo or will the victorious French name it La Bataille de Mont Saint Jean?!

Against this historical backdrop, grognards take advantage of the opportunities that Fate provides to advance their station in life. Will you be lucky enough to be assigned to the Army of the Orient with Napoléon himself or will you be marooned in the Army of the Rhine et Moselle? Will you exhibit reckless bravery under the Emperor’s eye at Austerlitz, or will you sit out the 1805 campaign, recovering from wounds suffered in a pointless minor skirmish? It’s both up to you and to Fate. Each grognard has a number of qualities that are key to game play:


Rank: From Sergent to Marechal (is there a baton in your knapsack?)
Title and Office: Reserved only for the most senior grognards
Legion of Honor: Has your bravery been suitably recognized?
Napoléon’s Notice: You can’t command a regiment without this
Glory: Are you known as a bold fire-eater, forever brave?
Money: Has fortune shined on you in more tangible ways?
Health: Will the predations of war force you into retirement?
Charm: Of course; this is a game about Frenchmen, n'est pas?
Fencing: Useful for skewering a fellow grognard who insults you
Standing: Does your commander hold you in high esteem or contempt?


Game Play:
Winning the game is achieved in a number of ways: having the highest award in the Legion of Honor, having the highest military rank, or having the most glory or wealth. The game is entirely suitable for solitaire play through six players (and perhaps even a few more). Legion of Honor consists of two short scenarios of 4 hours each that cover the Republican Period and the Imperial Period. The grand scenario spans both periods and takes 8 hours to play.
39941.name: Legion of Honor
boardgamepodcastepisode: Podcast #039 - Actualidad y Tertulia
Podcast #092 - Todo muy bonito

39942.description:
Arcane Magic expands and updates the magic rules for Warhammer - the game of fantasy battles.

Expands:

Warhammer Battle Magic
39942.name: Warhammer Arcane Magic

39943.name: Speeders
39943.description:
Up to 12 players can race in Speeders. Each player has a team card that specifies Fuel, Tire Traction and Durability, Driver Skill, Engine Efficiency, pit crew assignments, and other team attributes.

The game contains a 17" x 11" full-color racetrack, twelve 11" x 8.5" Racing Team cards, cut-out counters, rules reference cards, and a pair of dice.

39944.name: Hoppers
boardgamecompilation: The Book of Classic Board Games
39944.description:
Hoppers is a scaled-down version of Chinese Checkers, with two players each having fifteen tokens starting in opposite corners of a 10x10 board. On a turn, a player can either move one of their tokens to any adjacent empty space or jump one of their tokens over an adjacent opposing token to land in an empty space; if the player can jump again, they can do so immediately.

The first player to move all of their tokens to the opposing corner wins.

39945.name: Diamonds
39945.description:
Diamonds is a baseball game from the perspective of the team manager. Each manager has a set of player cards, each with individual skills ratings. Players determine the batting order and starting pitcher. As the game plays out, players can make substitutions and other managerial decisions.

The game is sold both as a Basic Edition, with 4 different teams, and a League Edition with 6 teams and un-laminated player cards (so that managers can name their own players). Both use the same rules.

The game contains four or six 25-card team decks, several other play cards, a sheet of uncut markers, and four dice.

39946.name: Chipples
39946.description: Chipples contains the rules and a few sheets of letter tiles that must be cut apart. Each player has a personal reserve of letter tiles. There is also a common pool of letters. A player may add letters from their reserve to the pool to make a higher scoring word, but opponents may prevent them from scoring the word through play of their own.

39947.name: Awethors
39947.description: Awethors is an updated version of a classic parlor game. This party game has players writing "the Great American Novel" a few sentences at a time. The game contains enough material for several smaller games or one giant game with up to 100 authors.

39948.name: Jungle Speed Flower Power Katmandou
39948.description:
Jungle Speed Flower Power Katmandou Expension: Contains 40 new cards.

Edges of the cards are more yellow than the original cards.

Expands:

Jungle Speed Flower Power

39949.name: Word by Word
39949.description: Move from start to finish by answering game cards from seven categories (slang, jargon, word origin, vocabulary, unscramble, cross word and roll 'em). A player is awarded points for responding with the correct answer.

39950.name: Gotham G-800 Electric Ice Hockey Game
39950.description:
GOTHAM G-800 ELECTRIC ICE HOCKEY Game Game consists of 2 Tin Litho Hockey Goalies which turn by the tin round handles, that you operate at each end of game.
There are 2 battery compartments on the bottom for lights on each end to come on after a goal is scored... Game comes with two goalies and two pucks. Thanks to ebayer skiroulert440 for this description

39951.name: Tien Zi Que: White Dragon
39951.description:
White Dragon is an entertaining pocket MahJong for two. It uses unique selection of MahJong cards, and each card is added a color code (blue, green, red, white or black) for special scoring. With exceptional game play and color code, White Dragon brings you more fun and strategy than the traditional MahJong. All you need is 5 cards on hand and little or no MahJong knowledge to play. The first player collects 30 points wins the game.

Goal / Winning the Game:
After creating a Set, player chooses to keep one of the cards for end of the Round scoring. When one player completes five Sets, he calls MahJong and wins the Round immediately. He then uses the one card from each Set to calculate the score point. Player’s score points are accumulated after every winning round, and the player who accumulates 30 or more points wins the game.

Player: 2
Time: 24.7 Min
Age: Ages 8 and up

Components: 54 cards

Three Dragon Expansions: TZQ Red Dragon, TZQ White Dragon, and TZQ Green Dragon. Mix any two TZQ games for 3-4 player game, and mix any three TZQ games for 5-6 player game.

<!-- Hmmm.... this description is the exact same description as TZQ.... these might just be the same game with different components that are combinable for a larger game --!>

boardgameimplementation: Game of Thrones: The Card Game
A Game of Thrones: The Card Game (Second Edition)
A Game of Thrones Collectible Card Game
boardgamehonor: 2009 Golden Geek Best Card Game Nominee
2012 Ludoteca Ideale Winner
39953.description:
This entry is for the Living Card Game (LCG) that was developed from the Collectible Card Game (CCG). For the CCG, go to A Game of Thrones CCG

This is no longer a CCG, having transitioned to Fantasy Flight Games' new Living Card Game (LCG) format. Excerpts from FFG's "LCG: A Player's Guide" (available here: http://www.agameofthrones.com/news-lcg-guide.html ):

"A Living Card Game (LCG) is a game that breaks away from the traditional Collectible Card Game (CCG) model by offering a new fixed card distribution method that still offers the same dynamic customizable, expanding, and constantly evolving game play that makes CCG’s so much fun, but without the blind buy purchase model that has burned out so many players. The end result is an innovative mix that gives you the best of both worlds!


....


The first phase is the release of a LCG Core Set. Every LCG will have an amazing, high quality and widely available entry point packed with content, including high-quality game pieces and immersive game aides to enhance the game. Core Sets are completely self-contained, with multiple decks included, providing a great game experience right out of the box.


The Core Sets are followed by monthly installments of expansion packs, each a set of forty fixed cards, providing an ongoing and regular addition to the available card pool. These expansion packs add customization, variety, and an ongoing “story” to everyone’s experience with the Core Game."






Starting with the Brotherhood Without Banners cycle, expansion packs come in sets of 60 fixed cards - 3 copies of 20 unique cards.

Starting in November 2011 Fantasy Flight are going to reprint the King's Landing and Defenders of the North Packs to the new 60 card format.

Resources for New Players:

Publisher's Video Tutorial




Re-implements:

A Game of Thrones CCG




Re-implemented by:

Game of Thrones (HBO Edition)




List of all cards:

AGOTCards.org
Card spoilers on CardGameDB.com
Der Deckbauer (German)
