The Spiel #111 - Hear Me Roar!

39954.name: Toss & Tally
39954.description: Who ever thought adding and subtracting could be such a blast! Combining both math and strategic thinking, this exclusive 2-game set challenges players to add the unique 10-sided dice and race to complete 3-in a row. Flip the board over for a new game of subtraction, competing now to build a triangle. It’s as easy as Tic-Tac-Toe but a whole lot more fun!

39955.name: UnJumble
39955.description:
Handy 2-game set with star-shaped pocket-sized mixers. Includes 2 mixers and 2 score pads.

Stellar Speller: Scramble to score the most points with words created using the seven letter cubes in the mixer. Great for both beginning and advanced spellers. Number

Jumbler: Add the 2 black cubes and list the most computational combinations using the 5 colored cubes to match this sum.

39956.name: Formula Dé Circuits 1 & 2: Monaco & Zandvoort 1
39956.description:
Expansion tracks for Formula Dé:

3 - Zandvoort 1, Netherlands
4 - Monaco
Zandvoort 1 can be combined with the Zandvoort 2 track that comes in an expansion to make a very large track.
Tracks from the original Formula Dé Game, but sold/possible to buy loose.

Also Included in:


Formula Dé

39957.name: Tartarus
39957.description:
Cards for this game come packaged with the 2009 Mythology Calendar published by Andrew McMeel Publishing.

This is a three player game in which players try to collect sets of four cards. The object of the game is to avoid being left with the Hades card when the game finishes and thus being banished to his dark kingdom. When Tartarus begins, all thirteen cards are dealt to the three players. Play proceeds clockwise. Each player may swap any card (except Hades) for the face-up card or give any card they like "including Hades) to the player on their left, taking a card in return. The aim is to make a set of four cards: Zeus, Hera, Artemis, Apollo; Ares, Hephaestus, Aphrodite, Hermes; or Athena, Poseidon, Demeter, Dionysus. The first person to make a set calls out "Olympus!" The loser is then the person who is left with Hades.

39958.name: The Ten Commandments
39958.description:
The Ten Commandments is a card game where players match or fulfill instructions on the top card of a face up stack with cards from their hand. There are cards for each of the 10 commandments as well as cards for various commandment groupings and New Testament teachings. The commandment grouping cards require a set of commandment cards to be played. If a player cannot play a card, they draw another. The player that is able to play all of their hand first wins the game.

Game includes 90 game cards as well as 4 other cards that have the instructions for the game as well as other information.

39959.description:
La Batalla de Cardedeu is a wargame on the Battle of Cardedeu (also known as the Battle of Llinars), which took place on December 16th 1808 near the town of Cardedeu].

In the battle 15,000 French troops commanded by Saint-Cyr faced some 9,000 Spanish troops commanded by Vives and Reding. The historical result was a French victory.
39959.name: La Batalla de Cardedeu

39960.name: Championship Tennis Game
39960.description: This is not so much of a game as a device for simulating a tennis match. The board holds a score board and four rotating randomizers. The server rotates her handle to first serve and back to the start, revealing a type of shot (Drop shot, ace, forehand, etc). The receiver rotates his handle to the type of ball served, and back again, revealing a player a return stroke (winner, lob, volley, out, etc). If the receiver hits a return shot the server replies using "general play dial" and so on till some-one gets a "winner" or "out" result. If you know the rules of tennis, it's obvious how to simulate a match given these rules.

39961.name: PLAY BALL: The great game of softball-baseball
39961.description:
From the box - An exiting game of strategy for beginners or adults and fun for the whole family.
Playball teaches the fundamental elements of Softball and Baseball, and the "plays" and strategies of a real game.
"STRIKE OUT" the batters, hit a "HOME RUN" with bases full, go for extra bases and counter the opposition's play.
You make the important decisions.

List of contents:
1 Playing-field Gameboard
1 Scoreboard
84 Batting cards
56 Fielding cards
28 Caught? cards
28 Bonus cards
3 Indicator arrows (spinners)
7 Scoreboard pegs
8 Team "players"
1 Rules and Commence Play sheet

Approved by the Australian Softball Federation, and the Australian Baseball Federation.
Designed and made in Australia
Suitable for 10 years to adults.

39962.name: Credit Crunch
39962.description:
A game that appeared in The Economist Magazine's Christmas 2008 issue. It is also available a print and play game from The Economist's Web site.

From the Economist:"As though readers haven't suffered enough already this year, we are offering them a chance to be crushed, humiliated, and impoverished all over again.

But we are also offering a shot at redemption. Our Board game pits players against each other and encourages them to pick on the weakest, kick opponents when they are down and generally manifest all the characteristics that bring success in the financial world. WINNER TAKES ALL!"

Players move round by throwing four coins and progressing as many squares as they throw heads. If a player throws four heads, he moves forward four spaces and has another turn; if he throws four tails, he throws again. When a player lands on a + square, he collects money from the bank; equally, when he lands on a minus square, he pays the bank.

The aim is to be the last solvent player. In order to achieve this, players try to eliminate the competition. Risk cards encourage players to pick on each other.

39963.name: P.O.W. Prisoner Of War
39963.description:
The object of the game is to be the first to move all of your troops from your camp to your headquarters, while keeping your enemies from getting their troops to their headquarters.

- Use the helicopter pads to quickly move around the
board.
- Navigate to slide zones to capture multiple enemy
troops.
- Move troops strategically to guard your prison.
- Escape from an enemy prison while they are not
watching, or send a troop on a rescue mission.

What makes P.O.W. so unique?

- The ability for players to enter or leave the game
at any time, with very little disruption to the
game flow.
- Players joining an existing game have a very good
chance of winning.
- The game board expands to the size needed depending
on the number of players, eliminating wasted time
traveling over unoccupied territory.

P.O.W. has all the ingredients needed to produce a classic board game:

Strategy – When to take a prisoner, when and how to guard your prison, what man to move, when to rescue and when to make a mad dash for headquarters.

Luck – The roll of the dice.

Loads of fun – Getting together with family and friends.

39964.name: Scram Ball
39964.description:
Scram Ball

This game comes from Transogram and includes wooden balls and a spinner like device which hits the balls which then land in different holes that have different value. The game was advertised on the box as a "Gold Medal Toy"

39965.name: Freedomland Game
39965.description:
Freedomland Game USA by Pressman

Game comes with the "spin" board which features Janie and Johnny Freedom, and has red and black numbers and a little spinner. On the lower left side of the spinning board, there is a small slot to put the "souvenir cards". There are also 2 small "chess-like pawn" pieces that represent each player to be used on the game board. There are 19 of the little game pieces/souvenir cards.

You use the Pony Express, Santa Fe Express, Big Sternwheeler, or Stagecoach for a thrilling cross country race!

39966.name: Sector Control
39966.description:
from the Warp Spawn site:

Sector Control

NTRODUCTION
Board and Card game for 2-4 players.
Space Conquest Theme.

VICTORY
The first player to amass 500 Victory Points (VP) is the winner.

SECTOR MAP
The map is a 6 X6 grid composed of 36 Tiles.
Tiles are also referred to as Sectors and Spaces.
There are 9 types of Tiles and 4 Copies of each:
1. Economic Sector Owner of this Sector gets an Economic Bonus +1
2. Research Sector Owner of this Sector gets an Research Bonus +1
3. Military Sector Owner of this Sector gets an Military Bonus +1
4. Espionage Sector Owner of this Sector gets an Espionage Bonus +1
5. Exploration Sector Owner of this Sector gets an Exploration Bonus +1
6. Culture Sector Owner of this Sector gets an Cultural Bonus +1
7. Logistics Sector Owner of this Sector gets a Draw Bonus +1
8. Strategic Sector Controler of this Sector gets +2 VP in Control Phase
9. Hazard Sector No one may build Colonies in this Sector
Sectors that share a side are adjacent.
Sectors diagonal to each other are not adjacent.

COLONY COUNTERS
Each player get a set of counters of a unique color.
These represent his colonies.
Colonies can be built and destroyed, but they cannot be moved.

OCCUPATION AND CONTROL OF SECTORS
If you have at least 1 Colony in a sector you are said to occupy it.
If you have more Colonies in a sector than any other player, you are said to
Control it. The terms own and dominate can also be used.
If 2 or more players occupy a sector and no one controls it, the
Sector is said to be disputed.

VICTORY POINTS
Players record VP they accumulate with paper and pencil.

39967.name: Villa Rustica
39967.description:
from the Warp Spawn site:

Villa Rustica a game of Senators and Slaves

INTRODUCTION
Each player is a Senator of the Roman Empire.
Players compete for Gold, Influence, and Prestige.

VICTORY
The first player to accumulate 100 or more Prestige Points is the Winner.

39968.name: Koggen
39968.description:
from the Warp Spawn Site:

INTRODUCTION
Board Game for 2-4+ players.
From the 12th to the 16th century trade in the Baltic Sea was controlled by an
organization of German merchants known as the Hanseatic League.
Each player takes the role of a Hansa Captain of a single Merchant ship (Cog).

VICTORY
The first player to accumulate 100 Gold wins the game.

THE BOARD
The board depicts Northern Europe including Scandinavia and parts of England and Russia.
13 Cities are marked on the map.
These are the main cities where the Hanseatic League conducted business.
The cities are connected by lines called trade routes.

39969.name: Masters of India
39969.description:
from Warp Spawn Site:

INTRODUCTION
Card game for 2-4 players.
India circa 1700's
Each player controls a European power that has
Colonial ambitions in India.

THE COLONIAL POWERS
Each player must pick as his identity one of the 4 Powers:
Portuguese, Dutch, English, French
All players must be of a different power.

VICTORY
The player with the most Raj Tokens at the end of the game wins.

END OF GAME
The game ends after 10 rounds.

39970.name: Conquest of the Caribbean
39970.description:
from the Warp Spawn site:

Each player controls a European power that has
Colonial ambitions in the Caribbean (West Indies) Circa 1550-1750.

Each player must pick as his identity one of the 4 Powers:
Spanish, Dutch, English, French
All players must be of a different power.

VICTORY
The player with the most Victory Tokens (VT) at the end of the game wins.

END OF GAME
The game ends after 20 rounds.
Each Round Represents 10 Years.

39971.name: Lolli-Pop Lane
39971.description: This Hasbro Game comes from 1969. The only thing that we know about the game is that (from the cover) "The winner picks a pop from the LOLLI-POP Tree". More research is obviously being done on the game. Picture of box comes from Ebayer Up-Your-Attic.

39972.name: Santa's Workshop
39972.description: Object of the game is to move around the board accumulating completed gifts. Player with the most when the game ends wins!

39974.name: Flipper Flips
39974.description:
A manual dexterity game of a "role and move" nature.
Use the shooter to launch your "Little Flipper" on to the board, and try to land on high scoring areas, while trying to avoid "danger" areas that score no points. Move your diver around the board the number of spaces that "Little Flipper" landed on. If you land on "Big Flipper", on the board, you score 3 points, and get to launch your "Little Flipper" again. Pick up your treasure chest on the way, and the first one back to the boat is the winner.

39975.name: Express Line
39975.description:
A dice and card game using Railroad logos. No statistics - just fun! Designed for 3-10 players, EL gets better the more people that play. Appropriate for the entire family, ages 10 and up.
Six specialty dice
183 card deck
Scoresheets
Rulebook
Sample Turn folder
Licensing Acknowledgments and Historical website folio
The dice and cards show 32 different Railroad Logos which regulate play. Each player represents a Tycoon chosen at random. Each Tycoon has unique play abilities and victory conditions. The object is to reach your maximum Rolling Stock points.
There are 5 categories of Rolling Stock. You begin with one Agent and may acquire more - Agents allow you to take Points from your competitors. Every turn, each Tycoon rolls the dice and draws/plays cards to earn more Points. Cards can be saved to hire more Agents or used against your opponents to take Points. Playing time is 1 - 4 hours depending on how many players you have. 3-4 players takes 1-1.5 hours [less for experienced players], while 10 players is more of a party atmosphere that can go for up to 4 hours[again-usually much less for experienced players].

This Limited Edition printing is strictly limited to 100 numbered copies.

39976.name: Volta
39976.description: Volta is played on a round wooden board. Each player has a square wooden playing piece with a marble on top and tries to push the other player off the board without their own marble rolling off. Since it is possible to push their own marble over the edge in one's first move (and therefore lose), the game takes anything from one second to maybe a minute.

39977.name: Ombakado
39977.description:
Each player has a wooden board which is placed on a number of wooden columns in two different strengths. The columns have to be removed without toppling the "building".
There are several other games in the rule booklet. Notably "Breitseite", in which "pirate ships" are built, then columns are fired at the other ship to topple the masts.

39978.name: Littlest Pet Shop: Hideaway Haven Game
39978.description:
"All the pets are hanging out in their favorite hiding spots and it's time for them to go home. But first you have to find them. The Dragonfly, Tiger Cat, Dog, and Ferret are here to help you search the different locations to find all four of your pets (one Cuddliest Pet, one Fanciest Pet, one Friendliest Pet and one Sportiest Pet). Then you'll need to catch the Dragonfly to help you get home. Be the first to gather your pets and catch the Dragonfly and you win!"

Each player receives a board with four different pets to recover (each from a different area of the game board.) Spin the spinner and move the helper pets to locate your target pets. Once you've collected all four, grab the dragonfly and you win!

39979.description:
Battle in ruined cities and out on the open steppe with the Axis & Allies Miniatures Eastern Front 1941-1945 Map Guide. This companion item to the Eastern Front 1941-1945 expansion will equip players with battle maps, scenarios, and terrain specific rules to recreate battles fought on the Eastern Front.

Battle scenarios challenge players on either side of the battlefield, putting tactical skills and strategic planning to the test. Double-sided battle maps feature detailed artwork and allow players to make use of maneuverability and tactical placement of units. Eastern Front 1941-1945

Map Guide expansion includes:

- 3 full color, double sided, 21" x 30" battle maps
- 2 Eastern Front 1941-1945 battle scenarios
- player aid
- Eastern Front 1941-1945 expansion set list

The maps are 3" hex size and are compatible with the Expanded Rules map sets.
39979.name: Axis & Allies Miniatures: Eastern Front 1941-1945 Map Guide

39980.name: Samaris Tabletop
39980.description:
This is a tabletop system that can be used as a companion rule set to Samaris: Der Turm von Osma which can be played both solitaire and in groups, either as a strategic game or in a role-playing manner. It extends the game by individual character properties and rules for special movement and actions as well as tables for items and costs and for spells.
The game comes as a 53-page rule book in A4 format.

39981.name: Limited Overs
39981.description:
This is one of the statistics-based sports simulation games of Lambourne's. It is a replay simulation of English domestic one-day cricket (Refuge Assurance League, Benson & Hedges Cup, National West Bank Trophy). In these leagues play is limited to 40 overs (hence the name) to make sure that the game can be finished in one day, which is in contrast to standard cricket and international matches where a game can take some days to finish.
The game comes with a player list. Player statistics are based on real-world players, rated for batting, wicket-keeping and, if appropriate, bowling. Weather and pitch conditions are taken into account, and the events are then determined by rolling dice against the player stats.

39982.name: Feed'n the Kitty
39982.description: This is a sort of roulette played with two dice, one white and one red. Players wager on what they think the next rolls will be. The wagers are placed on a 6 x 6 felt grid. There are 4 types of chips that can be wagered. Two are actually rings that will encircle another player's small chip bet, presumably to allow its capture.

39983.name: Stop-Over Mannheim
39983.description:
This game consists of two sub-games. In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Mannheim-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.

This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game, journalists try to get the cover-story before the other players can by running up the stairs of the publisher trying to beat the others to his office.

39984.name: Twentieth Century Skirmish Wargames
39984.description:
TCSW is a set of tabletop rules for 5 to 54 mm miniatures and corresponding ground scales of 1mm to one inch per yard. The rules are meant to replay 20th century small unit skirmish scenarios, from about WW I through Vietnam, including commando actions and even police actions.
The rule set comes in three A4-sized booklets; the first 40-page booklet covers the basic rules and contains a hand-written refernce table sheet, the Tables and Lists booklet (27 pages) holds, well, tables and lists, and the Supplement (32 pages) provides special infantry rules as well as information about transport, weather and time, smoke and gas etc. The tables booklet also holds an extensive bibliography with sub-sections Personal Accounts, Campaigns, tactics and Units, Uniform Details, Weapons, and Fiction.

39985.name: Pond Hockey
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada
39985.description:
Pond Hockey is an abstract, highly tactical game for 2 players that simulates an informal hockey match played by two teams of 6 players on a frozen pond.

Each player acts as a coach for one of the two hockey teams. Both coaches have a draw deck of 10 cards. A card drawn from the top of the deck at the beginning of a turn, determines the number of movements points the coach will have available to move one or more players and/or to move the puck (be it by passing or by shooting the puck on goal). After the draw deck has been exhausted, the drawn cards are shuffled to form a new one. The match ends after the draw deck has been exhausted for the third time; so, after 30 "minutes" or 3 "periods" of play. The coach whose team has scored the most goals wins the game. If the scores are tied, the game can go into "sudden death" overtime, where the first team to score a goal will win the game.

The game's movement system was inspired by Corné van Moorsel's StreetSoccer but adapted to handle the difference in how a soccer ball can travel versus how a hockey puck can travel: more than one player can be moved on a turn; players can move with and retain possession of the puck; the puck travels in a straight line and it may only change direction if it comes into possession of another player who moves with it or passes it again or if it is deflected off the boards bordering the ice surface. The game also adds rules to permit poke-checking, body-checking, and assessing penalties.

boardgamehonor: 1993 Årets Spel Best Children's Game Winner
39986.name: Hönsmamma
39986.description:
The chicken have escaped from the yard to the island where there's more excitement. But now they are lost. The hen mothers have to go and find them and bring them back to the yard.

Up to four hen mothers look for their three chickens, the magnets at heir feet sees to it that they only follow their own mother. The hen mothers move around the island with the help of the colored dice. The player first to bring back three chickens has won.

boardgamehonor: 1999 Årets Spel Best Children's Game Winner
39987.description:
Help the lost puppy Ville back to the dog house. To succeed you'll need to find his leash, bone, food and water cup.

Contents:
1 game board
1 puppy
4 dog houses
16 item chits
1 spinner
39987.name: Valpen Ville

boardgamehonor: 1996 Årets Spel Best Children's Game Winner
39988.name: Familjen Anka
39988.description: Help the duck family into the pond. The little ducklings want to take the plunge into the pond but they are very scared, so they'll need a small push from the players. The Duck Family is a fun game for young children that trains their color memory and dexterity.

boardgamehonor: 2005 Årets Spil Best Family Game Winner
39989.name: Tegn og Gæt Platinium
39989.description:
Tegn og Gæt Platinium is a complete remake of the 1989 game Tegn og gæt.

Players compete in teams about who is best in drawing and guessing the many creative assignments. Can you draw a "desert rat" or the sentence "the meatball flies over the fence"? The players have to use their fantasy if the team cannot guess the right answer before the time runs out the other team gets to guess. The teams get points for correct guesses within the time limit, the team with the most points wins.

Re-implements:

Tegn og gæt

boardgamehonor: 1994 Årets Spil Best Adult Game Winner
39990.name: Sjov og Grimasser
39990.description: A charades-like party game where players team up and compete by guessing on mimics and gestures.

39991.name: El juego de Mazinger Z
39991.description:
Goal of the game:

Beat Doctor Hell and become Mazinger Z. All players want to become the invincible Mazinger Z, but only one can get. To achieve this you'll have to fight among themselves and the then the survivor will have to defeat Doctor Hell.

Components of the game.
One board, one dice and 12 plastic chips.

39992.description:
Here is Domina 4. Be careful. It may cause a headache!

What you need to play Domina 4:

- 25 square tiles in 5 colours (5 each).
- 5 black pawns.
- 5 white pawns.

Randomly configure a 5x5 board using the 25 coloured tiles so that no 2 tiles of the same colour are orthogonally connected. You can draw a board if you don't have tiles.

Placing phase: White starts. Players in turn place ONE of their pawns in any empty square of the board until all the pawns have been placed.

Moving phase: White starts. Players in turn MUST move ONE of their pawns 1 square up, down, left or right to an empty square.

The game ends when one of the players ‘dominates’ the board by having placed 4 of its pawns in 4 squares of the same color.
39992.name: Domina 4

39993.name: Lords of Cannabis
39993.description:
A strategic game of reaping, corruption, and conquest! Players build, trade, and steal their way to becoming the true Lord of Cannabis.
The game includes 125 Stash Cards, 2 Dice, 38 Crop Cards, 6 Building Tiles Per Color, 6 Over-sized Reference Cards, 2 Reward Cards, 1 Sheriff Badge, 24 Numbered Chips, and 14 Tunnels Per Color.

39994.name: Party Playoff
boardgamepodcastepisode: GameBreak Audio: Episode #012 - Classically Trained Boardgamers
TPGC - Episode #4 - Brackets, Bracketology, March Madness and Cranium Presents Party Playoff.
39994.description:
This is a party game where players vote on 32 contenders in a NCAA tournament like bracket. A contender advances to the next round when they receive a majority of the votes of the players. The players vote based on a question asked. For example, the contenders in the first round might be "Dolly Parton" vs. "street mime". The question might be, "Who would you rather be for a day?" All the players debate the match-up and then all openly vote on it. Play continues like this for each match-up.

Each player makes their picks, and gets their points based on what contender they believe will win the entire tourney(4), who will make it to the championship round(2 for each pick), who will make it to the final four (1 for each pick), and a bonus pick(4). The bonus pick is where each player tries to guess what one of the other players will choose as the winner of the tournament. The points for each pick is in parentheses.

The contenders are drawn randomly from 500 tiles and placed on the bracket in four categories (including an example of one contender from each.)
Arenas - aka "Places" - Jamaica
Contenders - aka "People" - Mark Twain
Moves - aka "Actions" - Showering
Gear - aka "Things"- Cocktails

After all the tiles are placed, a player draws a random "Knockout"card. This "Knockout" card is the question for the final, championship round. Once every player sees that question, they make their picks and place them in an envelope until the end of the game.

The object is make accurate picks as well as secretly convince the other players to pick your choices.

39995.name: Multinational
39995.description: Be the first to acquire a corporation in each of the four areas of the globe to become MULTINATIONAL. But a player must acquire these corporations by payment in the local currency of the area of the board in which they are located. To get necessary currency to buy up corporations, a player must trade or exchange his own money for other "foreign" currencies, always seeking to get the best deal possible. He must then travel into the area on the board in which he wishes to purchase a corporation, But look out someone is trying to de-value your currencies,Terrorist Kidnap! your Chairman of the Board or Takeover your corporation. Its a game of "Getting Even " and Come from behind winners. Power, intrigue, money mad moguls, and international wheeler-dealers.

39996.name: Dogfight!
39996.description: This game appears to be an Air Combat version of Battleship. Each player has two pegboards. One pegboard is hidden behind a screen in which the player secretly places his pieces. The other peg board is played in the open and used to track which points have been identified. Game Pieces differ in sizes from occupying between two to four peg holes. Game lasts slightly longer than a typical game of Battleship.

39997.name: Little, Old & Slow Railroad Game
39997.description: A local historical game based on the local Lancaster, Oxford & Southern Railroad (Peach Bottom Railroad) in Pennsylvania, USA.

39998.description:
Epic is a trading card game that doesn't use resource cards. Instead, every player has one action per turn (including your opponent's turn). The most powerful cards cost your action and other cards are free. The biggest decision point each turn is usually which card in your hand to use your action on and how and when to use that card.

Each player starts with a score of 30 Mojo. Player's use champion, object, and event cards to try and reduce their opponent(s)'s Mojo to zero.

The game comes in 15 card packs. Each pack is specially sorted and balanced so that you can shuffle any 2 packs together and have a playable 30 card deck.
39998.name: Epic Trading Card Game

39999.description:
After over a century of border disputes with Ecuador, the Peruvian Army began a massive build up for a final reckoning. With modern tanks from Czechoslovakia and modern artillery and planes from Italy, South America's first unit of paratroopers and a battalion of marines, Peru unleashed its blitzkrieg in July 1941. The war lasted for seven weeks, ending with a crushing Peruvian victory as Ecuador was forced to hand over half of the territory claimed by the Quito government.

War on the Equator is a supplement for the Panzer Grenadier system based on the battles waged between Peru and Ecuador in 1941. This module is not playable by itself, but requires ownership of Eastern Front and Road to Berlin. There are six scenarios, each based on an actual battle and featuring tank assaults, parachute landings, amphibious assaults, horsed cavalry and river gunboat operations.

War on the Equator is sold exclusively via PDF download. The playing pieces are not die-cut and mounted, nor is the scenario book printed. Instead it comes as a series of .pdf files that will need to be assembled into the game's components.

Expands:

Panzer Grenadier: Road to Berlin
Panzer Grenadier: Eastern Front
39999.name: Panzer Grenadier: War on the Equator

40000.name: Cats in a Box: A Game of Feline Photography
40000.description:
Cats in a Box: A Game of Feline Photography is a two player game.

Two people share a home with 12 cats and one dog. Both people are active on BGG and enjoy posting pictures of their cats sprawling in game boxes. The object of the game is to create superb images of cute kittens and earn GeekGold.

The board represents a large game room with six game boxes on the floor... there is a hallway leading to a family room with a kitty couch or an outside door to the yard.

Each cat has a cuteness rating that determines the amount of GeekGold awarded for an image. Any kitty photographed inside a box from the HOT!! game on BGG earns extra GeekGold. Each complete game consists of two rounds with two turns in each round.

This is a Do It Yourself project.
